message.name: UBX-ACK-ACK
message.comment: Output upon processing of an input message. A UBX-ACK-ACK is sent as soon as possible but at least within one second.

block.name: clsID
block.comment: Class ID of the Acknowledged Message

block.name: msgID
block.comment: Message ID of the Acknowledged Message

message.name: UBX-ACK-NAK
message.comment: Output upon processing of an input message. A UBX-ACK-NAK is sent as soon as possible but at least within one second.

block.name: clsID
block.comment: Class ID of the Not-Acknowledged Message

block.name: msgID
block.comment: Message ID of the Not-Acknowledged Message

message.name: UBX-AID-ALM
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead Poll GPS aiding data (Almanac) for all 32 SVs by sending this message to the receiver without any payload. The receiver will return 32 messages of type AID- ALM as defined below.

message.name: UBX-AID-ALM
message.description: Poll GPS aiding almanac data for a SV
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead Poll GPS aiding data (Almanac) for an SV by sending this message to the receiver. The receiver will return one message of type AID-ALM as defined below.

block.name: svid
block.comment: SV ID for which the receiver shall return its Almanac Data (Valid Range: 1 .. 32 or 51, 56, 63).

message.name: UBX-AID-ALM
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead If the WEEK Value is 0, DWRD0 to DWRD7 are not sent as the Almanac is not available for the given SV. This may happen even if NAV-SVINFO and RXM- SVSI are indicating almanac availability as the internal data may not represent the content of an original broadcast almanac (or only parts thereof). DWORD0 to DWORD7 contain the 8 words following the Hand-Over Word ( HOW ) from the GPS navigation message, either pages 1 to 24 of sub-frame 5 or pages 2 to 10 of subframe 4. See IS-GPS-200 for a full description of the contents of the Almanac pages. In DWORD0 to DWORD7, the parity bits have been removed, and the 24 bits of data are located in Bits 0 to 23. Bits 24 to 31 shall be ignored. Example: Parameter e (Eccentricity) from Almanac Subframe 4/5, Word 3, Bits 69-84 within the subframe can be found in DWRD0, Bits 15-0 whereas Bit 0 is the LSB.

block.name: svid
block.comment: SV ID for which this Almanac Data is (Valid Range: 1 .. 32 or 51, 56, 63).

block.name: week
block.comment: Issue Date of Almanac (GPS week number)

message.name: UBX-AID-AOP
message.description: Poll AssistNow Autonomous data, all satellites
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead Poll AssistNow Autonomous aiding data for all GPS satellites by sending this empty message. The receiver will return an AID-AOP message (see definition below) for each GPS satellite for which data is available.

message.name: UBX-AID-AOP
message.description: Poll AssistNow Autonomous data, one GPS satellite
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead Poll the AssistNow Autonomous data for the specified GPS satellite. The receiver will return a AID-AOP message (see definition below) if data is available for the requested satellite.

block.name: svid
block.comment: GPS SV ID for which the data is requested (valid range: 1..32).

message.name: UBX-AID-AOP
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead If enabled, this message is output at irregular intervals. It is output whenever AssistNow Autonomous has produced new data for a satellite. Depending on the availability of the optional data the receiver will output either version of the message. If this message is polled using one of the two poll requests described above the receiver will send this message if AssistNow Autonomous data is available or the corresponding poll request message if no AssistNow Autonomous data is available for each satellite (i.e. svid 1..32). At the user's choice the optional data may be chopped from the payload of a previously polled message when sending the message back to the receiver. Sending a valid AID- AOP message to the receiver will automatically enable the AssistNow Autonomous feature on the receiver. See the section AssistNow Autonomous in the receiver description for details on this feature.

message.name: UBX-AID-EPH
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead Poll GPS Aiding Data (Ephemeris) for all 32 SVs by sending this message to the receiver without any payload. The receiver will return 32 messages of type AID- EPH as defined below.

message.name: UBX-AID-EPH
message.description: Poll GPS aiding ephemeris data for a SV
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead Poll GPS Constellation Data (Ephemeris) for an SV by sending this message to the receiver. The receiver will return one message of type AID-EPH as defined below.

block.name: svid
block.comment: SV ID for which the receiver shall return its Ephemeris Data (Valid Range: 1 .. 32).

message.name: UBX-AID-EPH
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead SF1D0 to SF3D7 is only sent if ephemeris is available for this SV. If not, the payload may be reduced to 8 Bytes, or all bytes are set to zero, indicating that this SV Number does not have valid ephemeris for the moment. This may happen even if NAV-SVINFO and RXM-SVSI are indicating ephemeris availability as the internal data may not represent the content of an original broadcast ephemeris (or only parts thereof). SF1D0 to SF3D7 contain the 24 words following the Hand-Over Word ( HOW ) from the GPS navigation message, subframes 1 to 3. The Truncated TOW Count is not valid and cannot be used. See IS-GPS-200 for a full description of the contents of the Subframes. In SF1D0 to SF3D7, the parity bits have been removed, and the 24 bits of data are located in Bits 0 to 23. Bits 24 to 31 shall be ignored. When polled, the data contained in this message does not represent the full original ephemeris broadcast. Some fields that are irrelevant to u-blox receivers may be missing. The week number in Subframe 1 has already been modified to match the Time Of Ephemeris (TOE).

block.name: svid
block.comment: SV ID for which this ephemeris data is (Valid Range: 1 .. 32).

block.name: how
block.comment: Hand-Over Word of first Subframe. This is required if data is sent to the receiver. 0 indicates that no Ephemeris Data is following.

message.name: UBX-AID-HUI
message.description: Poll GPS health, UTC, ionosphere parameters
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead -

message.name: UBX-AID-HUI
message.description: GPS health, UTC and ionosphere parameters
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead This message contains a health bit mask, UTC time and Klobuchar parameters. For more information on these parameters, see the ICD-GPS-200 documentation.

block.name: health
block.comment: Bitmask, every bit represenst a GPS SV (1- 32). If the bit is set the SV is healthy.

block.name: utcLS
block.comment: UTC - time difference due to leap seconds before event

block.name: utcWNF
block.comment: UTC - week number when next leap second event occurs

block.name: utcDN
block.comment: UTC - day of week when next leap second event occurs

block.name: utcLSF
block.comment: UTC - time difference due to leap seconds after event

block.name: utcSpare
block.comment: UTC - Spare to ensure structure is a multiple of 4 bytes

type.name: healthValid
type.description: Healthmask field in this message is valid

type.name: utcValid
type.description: UTC parameter fields in this message are valid

type.name: klobValid
type.description: Klobuchar parameter fields in this message are valid

message.name: UBX-AID-INI
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead -

message.name: UBX-AID-INI
message.description: Aiding position, time, frequency, clock drift
message.comment: All UBX-AID messages are deprecated; use UBX-MGA messages instead This message contains position, time and clock drift information. The position can be input in either the ECEF X/Y/Z coordinate system or as lat/lon/height. The time can either be input as inexact value via the standard communication interface, suffering from latency depending on the baud rate, or using hardware time synchronization where an accurate time pulse is input on the external interrupts. It is also possible to supply hardware frequency aiding by connecting a continuous signal to an external interrupt.

block.name: ecefXOrLat
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF X coordinate or latitude, depending on flags below

block.name: ecefYOrLon
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate or longitude, depending on flags below

block.name: ecefZOrAlt
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate or altitude, depending on flags below

type.name: fEdge
type.description: use falling edge (default rising)

type.name: tm1
type.description: time mark on extint 1 (default extint 0)

type.name: f1
type.description: frequency on extint 1 (default extint 0)

block.name: wnoOrDate
block.comment: Actual week number or yearSince2000/Month (YYMM), depending on flags below

block.name: towOrTime
block.comment: Actual time of week or DayOfMonth/Hour/Minute/Second (DDHHMMSS), depending on flags below

block.name: towNs
block.comment: Fractional part of time of week

block.name: clkDOrFreq
block.comment: Clock drift or frequency, depending on flags below

block.name: clkDAccOrFreqAcc
block.comment: Accuracy of clock drift or frequency, depending on flags below

type.name: pos
type.description: Position is valid

type.name: time
type.description: Time is valid

type.name: clockD
type.description: Clock drift data contains valid clock drift, must not be set together with clockF

type.name: tp
type.description: Use time pulse

type.name: clockF
type.description: Clock drift data contains valid frequency, must not be set together with clockD

type.name: lla
type.description: Position is given in lat/long/alt (default is ECEF)

type.name: altInv
type.description: Altitude is not valid, if lla was set

type.name: prevTm
type.description: Use time mark received before AID-INI message (default uses mark received after message)

type.name: utc
type.description: Time is given as UTC date/time (default is GPS wno/tow)

message.name: UBX-CFG-ANT
message.comment: This message allows the user to configure the antenna supervisor. The antenna supervisor can be used to detect the status of an active antenna and control it. It can be used to turn off the supply to the antenna in the event of a short cirquit (for example) or to manage power consumption in power save mode. Refer to antenna supervisor configuration in the Integration manual for more information regarding the behavior of the antenna supervisor. Refer to UBX-MON-HW for a description of the fields in the message used to obtain the status of the antenna. Note that not all pins can be used for antenna supervisor operation, it is recommended that you use the default pins, consult the Integration manual if you need to use other pins.

type.name: svcs
type.description: Enable antenna supply voltage control signal

type.name: scd
type.description: Enable short circuit detection

type.name: ocd
type.description: Enable open circuit detection

type.name: pdwnOnSCD
type.description: Power down antenna supply if short circuit is detected. (only in combination with bit 1)

type.name: recovery
type.description: Enable automatic recovery from short state

type.name: pinSwitch
type.description: PIO-pin used for switching antenna supply

type.name: pinSCD
type.description: PIO-pin used for detecting a short in the antenna supply

type.name: pinOCD
type.description: PIO-pin used for detecting open/not connected antenna

type.name: reconfig
type.description: if set to one, and this command is sent to the receiver, the receiver will reconfigure the pins as specified.

message.name: UBX-CFG-BATCH
message.comment: Gets or sets the configuration for data batching. See Data Batching for more information.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 23.01

type.name: enable
type.description: Enable data batching

type.name: extraPvt
type.description: Store extra PVT information The fields iTOW, tAcc, numSV, hMSL, vAcc, velN, velE, velD, sAcc, headAcc and pDOP in UBX-LOG- BATCH are only valid if this flag is set.

type.name: extraOdo
type.description: Store odometer data The fields distance, totalDistance and distanceStd in UBX-LOG-BATCH are only valid if this flag is set. Note: the odometer feature itself must also be enabled.

type.name: pioEnable
type.description: Enable PIO notification

type.name: pioActiveLow
type.description: PIO is active low

block.name: bufSize
block.comment: Size of buffer in number of epochs to store

block.name: notifThrs
block.comment: Buffer fill level that triggers PIO notification, in number of epochs stored

block.name: pioId
block.comment: PIO ID to use for buffer level notification

message.name: UBX-CFG-CFG
message.comment: See Receiver configuration for a detailed description on how receiver configuration should be used. The three masks are made up of individual bits, each bit indicating the sub-section of all configurations on which the corresponding action shall be carried out. The reserved bits in the masks must be set to '0'. For detailed information refer to the Organization of the configuration sections. Note that commands can be combined. The sequence of execution is clear, save, load.

block.name: clearMask
block.comment: Mask with configuration sub-sections to clear (i.e. load default configurations to permanent configurations in non-volatile memory)

type.name: ioPort
type.description: Communications port settings. Modifying this sub-section results in an IO system reset. Because of this undefined data may be output for a short period of time after receiving the message.

type.name: msgConf
type.description: Message configuration

type.name: infMsg
type.description: INF message configuration

type.name: navConf
type.description: Navigation configuration

type.name: rxmConf
type.description: Receiver Manager configuration

type.name: senConf
type.description: Sensor interface configuration (not supported in protocol versions less than 19)

type.name: rinvConf
type.description: Remote inventory configuration

type.name: antConf
type.description: Antenna configuration

type.name: logConf
type.description: Logging configuration

type.name: ftsConf
type.description: FTS configuration. Only applicable to the FTS product variant.

block.name: saveMask
block.comment: Mask with configuration sub-sections to save (i.e. save current configurations to non-volatile memory), see ID description of clearMask

block.name: loadMask
block.comment: Mask with configuration sub-sections to load (i.e. load permanent configurations from non-volatile memory to current configurations), see ID description of clearMask

block.name: deviceMask
block.comment: Mask which selects the memory devices for this command.

type.name: devBBR
type.description: Battery backed RAM

type.name: devFlash
type.description: Flash

type.name: devEEPROM
type.description: EEPROM

type.name: devSpiFlash
type.description: SPI Flash

message.name: UBX-CFG-DAT
message.comment: For more information see the description of Geodetic Systems and Frames.

block.name: majA
block.comment: Semi-major axis ( accepted range = 6,300, 000.0 to 6,500,000.0 meters ).

block.name: dX
block.comment: X axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

block.name: dY
block.comment: Y axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

block.name: dZ
block.comment: Z axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

block.name: rotX
block.comment: Rotation about the X axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

block.name: rotY
block.comment: Rotation about the Y axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

block.name: rotZ
block.comment: Rotation about the Z axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

block.name: scale
block.comment: Scale change ( accepted range is 0.0 to 50.0 parts per million ).

message.name: UBX-CFG-DAT
message.comment: Returns the parameters of the currently defined datum. If no user-defined datum has been set, this will default to WGS84.

block.name: majA
block.comment: Semi-major axis ( accepted range = 6,300, 000.0 to 6,500,000.0 meters ).

block.name: dX
block.comment: X axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

block.name: dY
block.comment: Y axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

block.name: dZ
block.comment: Z axis shift at the origin ( accepted range is +/- 5000.0 meters ).

block.name: rotX
block.comment: Rotation about the X axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

block.name: rotY
block.comment: Rotation about the Y axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

block.name: rotZ
block.comment: Rotation about the Z axis ( accepted range is +/- 20.0 milli-arc seconds ).

block.name: scale
block.comment: Scale change ( accepted range is 0.0 to 50.0 parts per million ).

message.name: UBX-CFG-DGNSS
message.comment: This message allows the user to configure the DGNSS configuration of the receiver.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with High Precision GNSS products)

block.name: dgnssMode
block.comment: Specifies differential mode: 2: RTK float: No attempts are made to fix ambiguities. 3: RTK fixed: Ambiguities are fixed whenever possible.

message.name: UBX-CFG-DOSC
message.comment: This message allows the characteristics of the internal or external oscillator to be described to the receiver. The gainVco and gainUncertainty parameters are normally set using the calibration process initiated using UBX-TIM-VCOCAL. The behavior of the system can be badly affected by setting the wrong values, so customers are advised to only change these parameters with care.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: numOsc
block.comment: Number of oscillators to configure (affects length of this message)

block.name: oscId
block.comment: Id of oscillator. 0 - internal oscillator 1 - external oscillator

type.name: isCalibrated
type.description: 1 if the oscillator gain is calibrated, 0 if not

type.name: controlIf
type.description: Communication interface for oscillator control: 0: Custom DAC attached to receiver's I2C 1: Microchip MCP4726 (12 bit DAC) attached to receiver's I2C 2: TI DAC8571 (16 bit DAC) attached to receiver's I2C 13: 12 bit DAC attached to host 14: 14 bit DAC attached to host 15: 16 bit DAC attached to host Note that for DACs attached to the host, the host must monitor UBX-TIM-DOSC messages and pass the supplied raw values on to the DAC.

block.name: phaseOffset
block.comment: Intended phase offset of the oscillator relative to the leading edge of the time pulse

block.name: withTemp
block.comment: Oscillator stability limit over operating temperature range (must be > 0)

block.name: timeToTemp
block.comment: The minimum time that it could take for a temperature variation to move the oscillator frequency by 'withTemp' (must be > 0)

block.name: gainVco
block.comment: Oscillator control gain/slope; change of frequency per unit change in raw control change

block.name: gainUncertainty
block.comment: Relative uncertainty (1 standard deviation) of oscillator control gain/slope

message.name: UBX-CFG-ESRC
message.comment: External time or frequency source configuration. The stability of time and frequency sources is described using different fields, see sourceType field documentation.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: numSources
block.comment: Number of sources (affects length of this message)

block.name: extInt
block.comment: EXTINT index of this source (0 for EXTINT0 and 1 for EXTINT1)

block.name: sourceType
block.comment: Source type: 0: none 1: frequency source; use withTemp, withAge, timeToTemp and maxDevLifeTime to describe the stability of the source 2: time source; use offset, offsetUncertainty and jitter fields to describe the stability of the source 3: feedback from external oscillator; stability data is taken from the external oscillator's configuration

type.name: polarity
type.description: Polarity of signal: 0: leading edge is rising edge 1: leading edge is falling edge

type.name: gnssUtc
type.description: Time base of timing signal: 0: GNSS - as specified in CFG-TP5 (or GPS if CFG-TP5 indicates UTC) 1: UTC Only used if sourceType is 2.

block.name: withTemp
block.comment: Oscillator stability limit over operating temperature range (must be > 0) Only used if sourceType is 1.

block.name: withAge
block.comment: Oscillator stability with age (must be > 0) Only used if sourceType is 1.

block.name: timeToTemp
block.comment: The minimum time that it could take for a temperature variation to move the oscillator frequency by 'withTemp' (must be > 0) Only used if sourceType is 1.

block.name: maxDevLifeTime
block.comment: Maximum frequency deviation during lifetime (must be > 0) Only used if sourceType is 1.

block.name: offset
block.comment: Phase offset of signal Only used if sourceType is 2.

block.name: offsetUncertainty
block.comment: Uncertainty of phase offset (one standard deviation) Only used if sourceType is 2.

block.name: jitter
block.comment: Phase jitter (must be > 0) Only used if sourceType is 2.

message.name: UBX-CFG-GEOFENCE
message.comment: Gets or sets the geofencing configuration. See the Geofencing description for feature details. If the receiver is sent a valid new configuration, it will respond with a UBX-ACK- ACK message and immediately change to the new configuration. Otherwise the receiver will reject the request, by issuing a UBX-ACK-NAK and continuing operation with the previous configuration. Note that the acknowledge message does not indicate whether the PIO configuration has been successfully applied (pin assigned), it only indicates the successful configuration of the feature. The configured PIO must be previously unoccupied for successful assignment.

block.name: numFences
block.comment: Number of geofences contained in this message. Note that the receiver can only store a limited number of geofences (currently 4).

block.name: confLvl
block.comment: Required confidence level for state evaluation. This value times the position's standard deviation (sigma) defines the confidence band. 0 = no confidence required 1 = 68% 2 = 95% 3 = 99.7% 4 = 99.99%

block.name: pioEnabled
block.comment: 1 = Enable PIO combined fence state output, 0 = disable

block.name: pinPolarity
block.comment: PIO pin polarity. 0 = Low means inside, 1 = Low means outside. Unknown state is always high.

block.name: lat
block.comment: Latitude of the geofence circle center

block.name: lon
block.comment: Longitude of the geofence circle center

message.name: UBX-CFG-GNSS
message.comment: Gets or sets the GNSS system channel sharing configuration. If the receiver is sent a valid new configuration, it will respond with a UBX-ACK- ACK message and immediately change to the new configuration. Otherwise the receiver will reject the request, by issuing a UBX-ACK-NAK and continuing operation with the previous configuration. Configuration requirements: It is necessary for at least one major GNSS to be enabled, after applying the new configuration to the current one. It is also required that at least 4 tracking channels are available to each enabled major GNSS, i.e. maxTrkCh must have a minimum value of 4 for each enabled major GNSS. The number of tracking channels in use must not exceed the number of tracking channels available in hardware, and the sum of all reserved tracking channels needs to be less than or equal to the number of tracking channels in use. Notes: To avoid cross-correlation issues, it is recommended that GPS and QZSS are always both enabled or both disabled. Polling this message returns the configuration of all supported GNSS, whether enabled or not; it may also include GNSS unsupported by the particular product, but in such cases the enable flag will always be unset. See section GNSS Configuration for a discussion of the use of this message. See section Satellite Numbering for a description of the GNSS IDs available. Configuration specific to the GNSS system can be done via other messages (e. g. UBX-CFG-SBAS).

block.name: numTrkChHw
block.comment: Number of tracking channels available in hardware (read only)

block.name: numTrkChUse
block.comment: (Read only in protocol versions greater than 23) Number of tracking channels to use. Must be > 0, <= numTrkChHw. If 0xFF, then number of tracking channels to use will be set to numTrkChHw.

block.name: resTrkCh
block.comment: (Read only in protocol versions greater than 23) Number of reserved (minimum) tracking channels for this system.

block.name: maxTrkCh
block.comment: (Read only in protocol versions greater than 23) Maximum number of tracking channels used for this system. Must be > 0, >= resTrkChn, <= numTrkChUse and <= maximum number of tracking channels supported for this system.

block.name: flags
block.comment: Bitfield of flags. At least one signal must be configured in every enabled system.

type.name: enable
type.description: Enable this system

type.name: sigCfgMask
type.description: Signal configuration mask When gnssId is 0 (GPS) 0x01 = GPS L1C/A 0x10 = GPS L2C When gnssId is 1 (SBAS) 0x01 = SBAS L1C/A When gnssId is 2 (Galileo) 0x01 = Galileo E1 (not supported in protocol versions less than 18) 0x20 = Galileo E5b When gnssId is 3 (BeiDou) 0x01 = BeiDou B1I 0x10 = BeiDou B2I When gnssId is 4 (IMES) 0x01 = IMES L1 When gnssId is 5 (QZSS) 0x01 = QZSS L1C/A 0x04 = QZSS L1S 0x10 = QZSS L2C When gnssId is 6 (GLONASS) 0x01 = GLONASS L1 0x10 = GLONASS L2

message.name: UBX-CFG-HNR
message.comment: The u-blox receivers support high rates of navigation update up to 30 Hz. The navigation solution output UBX-NAV-HNR will not be aligned to the top of a second. The update rate has a direct influence on the power consumption. The more fixes that are required, the more CPU power and communication resources are required. For most applications a 1 Hz update rate would be sufficient.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15.01, 16 and 17 (only with ADR products) u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

block.name: protocolID
block.comment: Protocol identifier, identifying the output protocol for this poll request. The following are valid protocol identifiers: 0: UBX protocol 1: NMEA protocol 2-255: Reserved

message.name: UBX-CFG-INF
message.comment: The value of infMsgMask[x] below is formed so that each bit represents one of the INF class messages (bit 0 for ERROR, bit 1 for WARNING and so on). For a complete list, see the Message class INF. Several configurations can be concatenated to one input message. In this case the payload length can be a multiple of the normal length. Output messages from the module contain only one configuration unit. Note that: I/O ports 1 and 2 correspond to serial ports 1 and 2. I/O port 0 is I2C (DDC). I/O port 3 is USB. I/O port 4 is SPI. I/O port 5 is reserved for future use.

block.name: protocolID
block.comment: Protocol identifier, identifying for which protocol the configuration is set/get. The following are valid protocol identifiers: 0: UBX protocol 1: NMEA protocol 2-255: Reserved

block.name: infMsgMask
block.comment: A bit mask, saying which information messages are enabled on each I/O port

type.name: ERROR
type.description: enable ERROR

type.name: WARNING
type.description: enable WARNING

type.name: NOTICE
type.description: enable NOTICE

type.name: TEST
type.description: enable TEST

type.name: DEBUG
type.description: enable DEBUG

type.name: bbThreshold
type.description: Broadband jamming detection threshold (unit = dB)

type.name: cwThreshold
type.description: CW jamming detection threshold (unit = dB)

type.name: algorithmBits
type.description: Reserved algorithm settings - should be set to 0x16B156 in hex for correct settings

type.name: enable
type.description: Enable interference detection

type.name: generalBits
type.description: General settings - should be set to 0x31E in hex for correct setting

type.name: antSetting
type.description: Antenna setting, 0=unknown, 1=passive, 2=active

type.name: enable2
type.description: Set to 1 to scan auxiliary bands (u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 only, otherwise ignored)

message.name: UBX-CFG-LOGFILTER
message.comment: This message can be used to configure the data logger, i.e. to enable/disable the log recording and to get/set the position entry filter settings. Position entries can be filtered based on time difference, position difference or current speed thresholds. Position and speed filtering also have a minimum time interval. A position is logged if any of the thresholds are exceeded. If a threshold is set to zero it is ignored. The maximum rate of position logging is 1 Hz. The filter settings will be configured to the provided values only if the 'applyAllFilterSettings' flag is set. This allows the recording to be enabled/disabled independently of configuring the filter settings. Configuring the data logger in the absence of a logging file is supported. By doing so, once the logging file is created, the data logger configuration will take effect immediately and logging recording and filtering will activate according to the configuration.

type.name: recordEnabled
type.description: 1 = enable recording, 0 = disable recording

type.name: psmOncePerWakupEnabled
type.description: 1 = enable recording only one single position per PSM on/off mode wake-up period, 0 = disable once per wake-up

type.name: applyAllFilterSettings
type.description: 1 = apply all filter settings, 0 = only apply recordEnabled

block.name: minInterval
block.comment: Minimum time interval between logged positions (0 = not set). This is only applied in combination with the speed and/or position thresholds. If both minInterval and timeThreshold are set, minInterval must be less than or equal to timeThreshold.

block.name: timeThreshold
block.comment: If the time difference is greater than the threshold, then the position is logged (0 = not set).

block.name: speedThreshold
block.comment: If the current speed is greater than the threshold, then the position is logged (0 = not set). minInterval also applies.

block.name: positionThreshold
block.comment: If the 3D position difference is greater than the threshold, then the position is logged (0 = not set). minInterval also applies.

message.name: UBX-CFG-MSG
message.comment: Get/set message rate configuration (s) to/from the receiver. See also section How to change between protocols. Send rate is relative to the event a message is registered on. For example, if the rate of a navigation message is set to 2, the message is sent every second navigation solution. For configuring NMEA messages, the section NMEA Messages Overview describes class and identifier numbers used.

block.name: rate
block.comment: Send rate on I/O port (6 ports)

message.name: UBX-CFG-MSG
message.comment: Set message rate configuration for the current port. See also section How to change between protocols.

message.name: UBX-CFG-NAV5
message.comment: See the Navigation Configuration Settings Description for a detailed description of how these settings affect receiver operation.

block.name: mask
block.comment: Parameters bitmask. Only the masked parameters will be applied.

type.name: dyn
type.description: Apply dynamic model settings

type.name: minEl
type.description: Apply minimum elevation settings

type.name: posFixMode
type.description: Apply fix mode settings

type.name: drLim
type.description: Reserved

type.name: posMask
type.description: Apply position mask settings

type.name: timeMask
type.description: Apply time mask settings

type.name: staticHoldMask
type.description: Apply static hold settings

type.name: dgpsMask
type.description: Apply DGPS settings

type.name: cnoThreshold
type.description: Apply CNO threshold settings (cnoThresh, cnoThreshNumSVs)

type.name: utc
type.description: Apply UTC settings (not supported in protocol versions less than 16).

block.name: dynModel
block.comment: Dynamic platform model: 0: portable 2: stationary 3: pedestrian 4: automotive 5: sea 6: airborne with <1g acceleration 7: airborne with <2g acceleration 8: airborne with <4g acceleration 9: wrist-worn watch (not supported in protocol versions less than 18) 10: bike (supported in protocol versions 19. 2)

block.name: fixMode
block.comment: Position fixing mode: 1: 2D only 2: 3D only 3: auto 2D/3D

block.name: fixedAlt
block.comment: Fixed altitude (mean sea level) for 2D fix mode

block.name: minElev
block.comment: Minimum elevation for a GNSS satellite to be used in NAV

block.name: cnoThreshNumSVs
block.comment: Number of satellites required to have C/N0 above cnoThresh for a fix to be attempted

block.name: cnoThresh
block.comment: C/N0 threshold for deciding whether to attempt a fix

block.name: staticHoldMaxDist
block.comment: Static hold distance threshold (before quitting static hold)

block.name: utcStandard
block.comment: UTC standard to be used: 0: Automatic; receiver selects based on GNSS configuration (see GNSS time bases) 3: UTC as operated by the U.S. Naval Observatory (USNO); derived from GPS time 5: UTC as combined from multiple European laboratories; derived from Galileo time 6: UTC as operated by the former Soviet Union (SU); derived from GLONASS time 7: UTC as operated by the National Time Service Center (NTSC), China; derived from BeiDou time (not supported in protocol versions less than 16).

message.name: UBX-CFG-NAVX5
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15, 15.01, 16 and 17

block.name: mask1
block.comment: First parameters bitmask. Only the flagged parameters will be applied, unused bits must be set to 0.

type.name: minMax
type.description: 1 = apply min/max SVs settings

type.name: minCno
type.description: 1 = apply minimum C/N0 setting

type.name: initial3dfix
type.description: 1 = apply initial 3D fix settings

type.name: wknRoll
type.description: 1 = apply GPS weeknumber rollover settings

type.name: ackAid
type.description: 1 = apply assistance acknowledgement settings

type.description: 1 = apply usePPP flag

type.name: aop

block.name: maxSVs
block.comment: Maximum number of satellites for navigation

block.name: minCNO
block.comment: Minimum satellite signal level for navigation

block.name: ackAiding
block.comment: 1 = issue acknowledgements for assistance message input

block.name: wknRollover
block.comment: GPS week rollover number; GPS week numbers will be set correctly from this week up to 1024 weeks after this week. Setting this to 0 reverts to firmware default.

block.name: usePPP
block.comment: 1 = use Precise Point Positioning (only available with the PPP product variant)

type.name: useAOP
type.description: 1 = enable AssistNow Autonomous

block.name: aopOrbMaxErr
block.comment: Maximum acceptable (modeled) AssistNow Autonomous orbit error (valid range = 5..1000, or 0 = reset to firmware default)

block.name: useAdr
block.comment: Only supported on certain products Enable/disable ADR sensor fusion (if 0: sensor fusion is disabled - if 1: sensor fusion is enabled).

message.name: UBX-CFG-NMEA
message.comment: This message version is provided for backwards compatibility only. Use the last version listed below instead (its fields are backwards compatible with this version, it just has extra fields defined). Get/set the NMEA protocol configuration. See section NMEA Protocol Configuration for a detailed description of the configuration effects on NMEA output.

type.name: posFilt
type.description: Enable position output for failed or invalid fixes

type.name: mskPosFilt
type.description: Enable position output for invalid fixes

type.name: timeFilt
type.description: Enable time output for invalid times

type.name: dateFilt
type.description: Enable date output for invalid dates

type.name: gpsOnlyFilter
type.description: Restrict output to GPS satellites only

type.name: trackFilt
type.description: Enable COG output even if COG is frozen

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Maximum number of SVs to report per TalkerId. 0: unlimited 8: 8 SVs 12: 12 SVs 16: 16 SVs

type.name: compat
type.description: enable compatibility mode. This might be needed for certain applications when customer's NMEA parser expects a fixed number of digits in position coordinates.

type.name: consider
type.description: enable considering mode.

message.name: UBX-CFG-NMEA
message.comment: This message version is provided for backwards compatibility only. Use the last version listed below instead (its fields are backwards compatible with this version, it just has extra fields defined). Get/set the NMEA protocol configuration. See section NMEA Protocol Configuration for a detailed description of the configuration effects on NMEA output.

type.name: posFilt
type.description: Enable position output for failed or invalid fixes

type.name: mskPosFilt

type.name: timeFilt

type.name: dateFilt
type.description: Enable date output for invalid dates

type.name: gpsOnlyFilter
type.description: Restrict output to GPS satellites only

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Maximum number of SVs to report per TalkerId. 0: unlimited 8: 8 SVs 12: 12 SVs 16: 16 SVs

type.name: compat
type.description: enable compatibility mode. This might be needed for certain applications when customer's NMEA parser expects a fixed number of digits in position coordinates.

type.name: consider
type.description: enable considering mode.

block.name: gnssToFilter
block.comment: Filters out satellites based on their GNSS. If a bitfield is enabled, the corresponding satellites will be not output.

type.name: gps
type.description: Disable reporting of GPS satellites

type.name: sbas
type.description: Disable reporting of SBAS satellites

type.name: galileo
type.description: Disable reporting of Galileo satellites

type.name: qzss
type.description: Disable reporting of QZSS satellites

type.name: glonass
type.description: Disable reporting of GLONASS satellites

type.name: beidou
type.description: Disable reporting of BeiDou satellites

block.name: svNumbering
block.comment: Configures the display of satellites that do not have an NMEA-defined value. Note: this does not apply to satellites with an unknown ID. 0: Strict - Satellites are not output 1: Extended - Use proprietary numbering (see Satellite Numbering)

block.name: mainTalkerId
block.comment: By default the main Talker ID (i.e. the Talker ID used for all messages other than GSV) is determined by the GNSS assignment of the receiver's channels (see UBX-CFG-GNSS). This field enables the main Talker ID to be overridden. 0: Main Talker ID is not overridden 1: Set main Talker ID to 'GP' 2: Set main Talker ID to 'GL' 3: Set main Talker ID to 'GN' 4: Set main Talker ID to 'GA' 5: Set main Talker ID to 'GB' 6: Set main Talker ID to 'GQ' (available in NMEA 4.11 or later)

block.name: gsvTalkerId
block.comment: By default the Talker ID for GSV messages is GNSS-specific (as defined by NMEA). This field enables the GSV Talker ID to be overridden. 0: Use GNSS-specific Talker ID (as defined by NMEA) 1: Use the main Talker ID

type.name: highPrec
type.description: enable high precision mode. This flag cannot be set in conjunction with either compatibility mode or Limit82 mode (not supported in protocol versions less than 20.01).

This field enables the main Talker ID to be overridden. 0: Main Talker ID is not overridden 1: Set main Talker ID to 'GP' 2: Set main Talker ID to 'GL' 3: Set main Talker ID to 'GN' 4: Set main Talker ID to 'GA' 5: Set main Talker ID to 'GB' 6: Set main Talker ID to 'GQ' (available in NMEA 4.11 or later)

block.comment: By default the Talker ID for GSV messages is GNSS-specific (as defined by NMEA). This field enables the GSV Talker ID to be overridden. 0: Use GNSS-specific Talker ID (as defined by NMEA) 1: Use the main Talker ID

block.comment: Sets the two characters that should be used for the BeiDou Talker ID. If these are set to zero, then the default BeiDou Talker ID will be used.

message.comment: This feature is not supported for the FTS product variant. -

type.name: useODO
type.description: Odometer-enabled flag

type.name: useCOG
type.description: Low-speed COG filter enabled flag

type.name: outLPVel
type.description: Output low-pass filtered velocity flag

type.name: outLPCog
type.description: Output low-pass filtered heading (COG) flag

type.name: profile
type.description: Profile type (0=running, 1=cycling, 2=swimming, 3=car, 4=custom)

block.name: cogMaxSpeed
block.comment: Speed below which course-over-ground (COG) is computed with the low-speed COG filter

block.name: cogMaxPosAcc

block.comment: COG low-pass filter level (at speed < 8 m/s), range 0..255

message.name: UBX-CFG-PM2
message.comment: This feature is not supported for either the ADR or FTS products. -

block.name: maxStartupStateDur
block.comment: Maximum time to spend in Acquisition state. If 0: bound disabled (see maxStartupStateDur) (not supported in protocol versions less than 17).

type.name: extintSel
type.description: EXTINT pin select 0 EXTINT0 1 EXTINT1

type.name: extintWake
type.description: EXTINT pin control 0 disabled 1 enabled, keep receiver awake as long as selected EXTINT pin is 'high'

type.name: extintBackup
type.description: EXTINT pin control 0 disabled 1 enabled, force receiver into BACKUP mode when selected EXTINT pin is 'low'

type.name: limitPeakCurr
type.description: Limit peak current 00 disabled 01 enabled, peak current is limited 10 reserved 11 reserved

type.name: waitTimeFix
type.description: Wait for Timefix (see waitTimeFix) 0 wait for normal fix OK before starting on time 1 wait for time fix OK before starting on time

type.name: updateRTC
type.description: Update Real Time Clock (see updateRTC) 0 do not wake up to update RTC. RTC is updated during normal on-time. 1 update RTC. The receiver adds extra wake-up cycles to update the RTC.

type.name: updateEPH
type.description: Update Ephemeris (see updateEPH) 0 do not wake up to update Ephemeris data 1 update Ephemeris. The receiver adds extra wake-up cycles to update the Ephemeris data

type.name: doNotEnterOff
type.description: Behavior of receiver in case of no fix (see doNotEnterOff) 0 receiver enters Inactive) Awaiting next search state 1 receiver does not enter (Inactive) Awaiting next search state but keeps trying to acquire a fix instead

type.name: mode
type.description: Mode of operation (see mode) 00 ON/OFF operation (PSMOO) 01 cyclic tracking operation (PSMCT) 10 reserved 11 reserved

block.name: updatePeriod
block.comment: Position update period. If set to 0, the receiver will never retry a fix and it will wait for external events

block.name: searchPeriod
block.comment: Acquisition retry period if previously failed. If set to 0, the receiver will never retry a startup

block.name: gridOffset
block.comment: Grid offset relative to GPS start of week

block.name: onTime
block.comment: Time to stay in Tracking state

message.name: UBX-CFG-PMS
message.comment: Using UBX-CFG-PMS to set Super-E mode to 1, 2 or 4 Hz navigation rates sets minAcqTime to 180 s instead of the default 300 s in protocol version 23.01.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15, 15.01, 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01

block.name: powerSetupValue
block.comment: Power setup value 0x00 = Full power 0x01 = Balanced 0x02 = Interval 0x03 = Aggressive with 1 Hz 0x04 = Aggressive with 2 Hz 0x05 = Aggressive with 4 Hz 0xFF = Invalid (only when polling)

block.name: period
block.comment: Position update period and search period. Recommended minimum period is 10 s, although the receiver accepts any value bigger than 5 s. Only valid when powerSetupValue set to Interval, otherwise must be set to '0'.

block.name: onTime
block.comment: Duration of the ON phase, must be smaller than the period. Only valid when powerSetupValue set to Interval, otherwise must be set to '0'.

message.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
message.description: Polls the configuration for one I/O port
message.comment: Sending this message with a port ID as payload results in having the receiver return the configuration for the specified port.

block.name: PortID
block.comment: Port identifier number (see the other versions of CFG-PRT for valid values)

message.name: UBX-CFG-PRT
message.comment: Several configurations can be concatenated to one input message. In this case the payload length can be a multiple of the normal length (see the other versions of CFG-PRT). Output messages from the module contain only one configuration unit. Note that this message can affect baud rate and other transmission parameters. Because there may be messages queued for transmission there may be uncertainty about which protocol applies to such messages. In addition a message currently in transmission may be corrupted by a protocol change. Host data reception parameters may have to be changed to be able to receive future messages, including the acknowledge message resulting from the CFG-PRT message.

block.name: portID
block.comment: Port identifier number (see Integration manual for valid UART port IDs)

type.name: en
type.description: Enable TX ready feature for this port

type.name: pol
type.description: Polarity 0 High-active 1 Low-active

type.name: pin
type.description: PIO to be used (must not be in use by another function)

type.name: thres
type.description: Threshold The given threshold is multiplied by 8 bytes. The TX ready PIN goes active after >= thres*8 bytes are pending for the port and going inactive after the last pending bytes have been written to hardware (0-4 bytes before end of stream). 0x000 no threshold 0x001 8byte 0x002 16byte ... 0x1FE 4080byte 0x1FF 4088byte

block.name: mode
block.comment: A bit mask describing the UART mode

type.name: charLen
type.description: Character length 00 5bit (not supported) 01 6bit (not supported) 10 7bit (supported only with parity) 11 8bit

type.name: parity
type.description: 000 Even parity 001 Odd parity 10X No parity X1X Reserved

type.name: nStopBits
type.description: Number of Stop bits 00 1 Stop bit 01 1.5 Stop bit 10 2 Stop bit 11 0.5 Stop bit

block.name: inProtoMask
block.comment: A mask describing which input protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

type.name: inUbx
type.description: UBX protocol

type.name: inNmea
type.description: NMEA protocol

type.name: inRtcm
type.description: RTCM2 protocol

type.name: inRtcm3
type.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

block.name: outProtoMask
block.comment: A mask describing which output protocols are active. Each bit of this mask is used for a protocol. Through that, multiple protocols can be defined on a single port.

type.name: outUbx
type.description: UBX protocol

type.name: outNmea
type.description: NMEA protocol

type.name: outRtcm3
type.description: RTCM3 protocol (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

type.name: extendedTxTimeout
type.description: Extended TX timeout: if set, the port will time out if allocated TX memory >=4 kB and no activity for 1. 5 s. If not set the port will time out if no activity for 1.5 s regardless on the amount of allocated TX memory .
