message.name: UBX-CFG-PWR
message.description: Put receiver in a defined power state
message.comment: This message is deprecated in protocol versions greater than 17. Use UBX-CFG- RST for GNSS start/stop and UBX-RXM-PMREQ for software backup. -

block.name: state
block.comment: Enter system state 0x52554E20: GNSS running 0x53544F50: GNSS stopped 0x42434B50: Software backup. USB interface will be disabled, other wakeup source is needed.

message.name: UBX-CFG-RATE
message.comment: This message allows the user to alter the rate at which navigation solutions (and the measurements that they depend on) are generated by the receiver. The calculation of the navigation solution will always be aligned to the top of a second zero (first second of the week) of the configured reference time system. (Navigation period is an integer multiple of the measurement period in protocol versions greater than 17). Each measurement triggers the measurements generation and, if available, raw data output. The navRate value defines that every nth measurement triggers a navigation epoch. The update rate has a direct influence on the power consumption. The more fixes that are required, the more CPU power and communication resources are required. For most applications a 1 Hz update rate would be sufficient. When using power save mode, measurement and navigation rate can differ from the values configured here. See Measurement and navigation rate with power save mode for details.

block.name: measRate
block.comment: The elapsed time between GNSS measurements, which defines the rate, e. g. 100 ms => 10 Hz, 1000 ms => 1 Hz, 10000 ms => 0.1 Hz. Measurement rate should be greater than or equal to 25 ms. (Measurement rate should be greater than or equal to 50 ms in protocol versions less than 24).

block.name: navRate
block.comment: The ratio between the number of measurements and the number of navigation solutions, e.g. 5 means five measurements for every navigation solution. Maximum value is 127. (This parameter is ignored and the navRate is fixed to 1 in protocol versions less than 18).

block.name: timeRef
block.comment: The time system to which measurements are aligned: 0: UTC time 1: GPS time 2: GLONASS time (not supported in protocol versions less than 18) 3: BeiDou time (not supported in protocol versions less than 18) 4: Galileo time (not supported in protocol versions less than 18)

message.name: UBX-CFG-RINV
message.comment: If N is greater than 30, the excess bytes are discarded.

type.name: dump
type.description: Dump data at startup. Does not work if flag binary is set.

type.name: binary
type.description: Data is binary.

block.name: data
block.comment: Data to store/stored in remote inventory.

message.name: UBX-CFG-RST
message.description: Reset receiver / Clear backup data structures
message.comment: Do not expect this message to be acknowledged by the receiver. Newer FW version will not acknowledge this message at all. Older FW version will acknowledge this message but the acknowledge may not be sent completely before the receiver is reset.

block.name: navBbrMask
block.comment: BBR sections to clear. The following special sets apply: 0x0000 Hot start 0x0001 Warm start 0xFFFF Cold start

type.name: eph
type.description: Ephemeris

type.name: alm
type.description: Almanac

type.name: health
type.description: Health

type.name: klob
type.description: Klobuchar parameters

type.name: pos
type.description: Position

type.name: clkd
type.description: Clock drift

type.name: osc
type.description: Oscillator parameter

type.name: utc
type.description: UTC correction + GPS leap seconds parameters

type.name: rtc
type.description: RTC

type.name: aop
type.description: Autonomous orbit parameters

block.name: resetMode
block.comment: Reset Type 0x00 = Hardware reset (watchdog) immediately 0x01 = Controlled software reset 0x02 = Controlled software reset (GNSS only) 0x04 = Hardware reset (watchdog) after shutdown 0x08 = Controlled GNSS stop 0x09 = Controlled GNSS start

message.name: UBX-CFG-RXM
message.comment: For a detailed description see section Power management in Integration manual Note that Power save mode cannot be selected when the receiver is configured to process GLONASS signals (using UBX-CFG-GNSS).
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15, 15.01, 16 and 17

block.name: lpMode
block.comment: Low power mode 0: Continuous mode 1: Power save mode 4: Continuous mode Note that for receivers with protocol versions larger or equal to 14, both Low power mode settings 0 and 4 configure the receiver to Continuous mode.

message.name: UBX-CFG-RXM
message.comment: For a detailed description see section Power Management.

block.name: lpMode
block.comment: Low power mode 0: Continuous mode 1: Power save mode 4: Continuous mode

message.name: UBX-CFG-SBAS
message.comment: This message configures the SBAS receiver subsystem (i.e. WAAS, EGNOS, MSAS). See the SBAS configuration settings description for a detailed description of how these settings affect receiver operation.

type.name: enabled
type.description: SBAS enabled (1) / disabled (0) - This field is deprecated; use UBX-CFG-GNSS to enable/disable SBAS operation

type.name: test
type.description: SBAS testbed: Use data anyhow (1) / Ignore data when in test mode (SBAS msg 0)

type.name: range
type.description: Use SBAS GEOs as a ranging source (for navigation)

type.name: diffCorr
type.description: Use SBAS differential corrections

type.name: integrity
type.description: Use SBAS integrity information. If enabled, the receiver will only use GPS satellites for which integrity information is available.

block.name: maxSBAS
block.comment: Maximum number of SBAS prioritized tracking channels (valid range: 0 - 3) to use (obsolete and superseded by UBX- CFG-GNSS in protocol versions 14+).

block.name: scanmode1
block.comment: Which SBAS PRN numbers to search for (bitmask). If all bits are set to zero, auto-scan (i.e. all valid PRNs) are searched. Every bit corresponds to a PRN number.

message.name: UBX-CFG-SLAS
message.comment: This message configures the QZSS SLAS (Sub-meter Level Augmentation System). See the SLAS Configuration Settings Description for a detailed description of how these settings affect receiver operation. To apply SLAS corrections, QZSS operation and L1S signal tracking must be enabled see UBX-CFG-GNSS
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 19.2 (only with ADR or UDR products)

type.name: enabled
type.description: Apply QZSS SLAS DGNSS corrections: Enabled (1) / Disabled (0)

type.name: test
type.description: Use QZSS SLAS data when in test mode (SLAS msg 0): Use data anyhow (1) / Ignore data when in Test Mode (0)

type.name: raim
type.description: Raim out measurements that are not corrected by QZSS SLAS, if at least 5 measurements are corrected: Enabled (1) / Disabled (0)

message.name: UBX-CFG-SMGR
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: minGNSSFix
block.comment: Minimum number of GNSS fixes before we commit to use it as a source

block.name: maxFreqChangeRate
block.comment: Maximum frequency change rate during disciplining. Must not exceed 30ppb/s

block.name: maxPhaseCorrRate
block.comment: Maximum phase correction rate in coherent time pulse mode. For maximum phase correction rate in corrective time pulse mode see maxSlewRate. Note that in coherent time pulse mode phase correction is achieved by intentional frequency offset. Allowing for a high phase correction rate can result in large intentional frequency offset. Must not exceed 100ns/s

block.name: freqTolerance
block.comment: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that frequency is out of tolerance

block.name: timeTolerance
block.comment: Limit of possible deviation from nominal before UBX-TIM-TOS indicates that time pulse is out of tolerance

type.name: measInternal
type.description: 1 = report the estimated offset of the internal oscillator based on the oscillator model

type.name: measGNSS
type.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to GNSS

type.name: measEXTINT0
type.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT0

type.name: measEXTINT1
type.description: 1 = report the internal oscillator's offset relative to the source on EXTINT1

block.name: maxSlewRate
block.comment: Maximum slew rate, the maximum time correction that shall be applied between locked pulses in corrective time pulse mode. To have no limit on the slew rate, set the flag disableMaxSlewRate to 1 For maximum phase correction rate in coherent time pulse mode see maxPhaseCorrRate.

type.name: disableInternal
type.description: 1 = disable disciplining of the internal oscillator

type.name: disableExternal
type.description: 1 = disable disciplining of the external oscillator

type.name: preferenceMode
type.description: Reference selection preference 0 - best frequency accuracy 1 - best phase accuracy

type.name: enableGNSS
type.description: 1 = enable use of GNSS as synchronization source

type.name: enableEXTINT0
type.description: 1 = enable use of EXTINT0 as synchronization source

type.name: enableEXTINT1
type.description: 1 = enable use of EXTINT1 as synchronization source

type.name: enableHostMeasInt
type.description: 1 = enable use of host measurements on the internal oscillator as synchronization source Measurements made by the host must be sent to the receiver using a UBX-TIM-SMEAS-DATA0 message.

type.name: enableHostMeasExt
type.description: 1 = enable use of host measurements on the external oscillator as synchronization source Measurements made by the host must be sent to the receiver using a UBX-TIM-SMEAS-DATA0 message.

type.name: useAnyFix
type.description: 0 - use over-determined navigation solutions only 1 - use any fix

type.name: disableMaxSlewRate
type.description: 0 - use the value in the field maxSlewRate for maximum time correction in corrective time pulse mode 1 - don't use the value in the field maxSlewRate

type.name: issueFreqWarning
type.description: 1 = issue a warning (via UBX-TIM-TOS flag) when frequency uncertainty exceeds freqTolerance

type.name: issueTimeWarning
type.description: 1 = issue a warning (via UBX-TIM-TOS flag) when time uncertainty exceeds timeTolerance

type.name: TPCoherent
type.description: Control time pulse coherency 0 - Coherent pulses. Time phase offsets will be corrected gradually by varying the GNSS oscillator rate within frequency tolerance limits. There will always be the correct number of GNSS oscillator cycles between time pulses. Given tight limits this may take a long time 1 - Non-coherent pulses. In this mode the receiver will correct time phase offsets as quickly as allowed by the specified maximum slew rate, in which case there may not be the expected number of GNSS oscillator cycles between time pulses. 2 - Post-initialization coherent pulses. The receiver will run in non-coherent mode as described above until the pulse timing has been corrected and PLL is active on the internal oscillator, but will then switch to coherent pulse mode.

type.name: disableOffset
type.description: 1 = disable automatic storage of oscillator offset

message.name: UBX-CFG-TMODE2
message.comment: This message is available only for timing receivers See the Time Mode Description for details. This message replaces the deprecated UBX-CFG-TMODE message.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15, 15.01, 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync or Time Sync products)

block.name: timeMode
block.comment: Time Transfer Mode: 0 Disabled 1 Survey In 2 Fixed Mode (true position information required) 3-255 Reserved

type.name: lla
type.description: Position is given in LAT/LON/ALT (default is ECEF)

type.name: altInv
type.description: Altitude is not valid, in case lla was set

block.name: ecefXOrLat
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF X coordinate or latitude, depending on flags above

block.name: ecefYOrLon
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate or longitude, depending on flags above

block.name: ecefZOrAlt
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate or altitude, depending on flags above

message.name: UBX-CFG-TMODE3
message.comment: Configures the receiver to be in Time Mode. The position referred to in this message is that of the Antenna Reference Point (ARP). See the Time Mode Description for details.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2 and 20.3 (only with High Precision GNSS products)

type.name: mode
type.description: Receiver Mode: 0 Disabled 1 Survey In 2 Fixed Mode (true ARP position information required) 3-255 Reserved

type.name: lla
type.description: Position is given in LAT/LON/ALT (default is ECEF)

block.name: ecefXOrLat
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF X coordinate (or latitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above

block.name: ecefYOrLon
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate (or longitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above

block.name: ecefZOrAlt
block.comment: WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate (or altitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above

block.name: ecefXOrLatHP
block.comment: High-precision WGS84 ECEF X coordinate (or latitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above. Must be in the range -99..+99. The precise WGS84 ECEF X coordinate in units of cm, or the precise WGS84 ECEF latitude in units of 1e-7 degrees, is given by ecefXOrLat + (ecefXOrLatHP * 1e-2)

block.name: ecefYOrLonHP
block.comment: High-precision WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate (or longitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above. Must be in the range -99..+99. The precise WGS84 ECEF Y coordinate in units of cm, or the precise WGS84 ECEF longitude in units of 1e-7 degrees, is given by ecefYOrLon + (ecefYOrLonHP * 1e-2)

block.name: ecefZOrAltHP
block.comment: High-precision WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate (or altitude) of the ARP position, depending on flags above. Must be in the range -99..+99. The precise WGS84 ECEF Z coordinate, or altitude coordinate, in units of cm is given by ecefZOrAlt + (ecefZOrAltHP * 1e-2)

message.name: UBX-CFG-TP5
message.description: Poll time pulse parameters for time pulse 0
message.comment: Sending this (empty / no-payload) message to the receiver results in the receiver returning a message of type UBX-CFG-TP5 with a payload as defined below for timepulse 0.

message.name: UBX-CFG-TP5
message.comment: Sending this message to the receiver results in the receiver returning a message of type UBX-CFG-TP5 with a payload as defined below for the specified time pulse.

message.name: UBX-CFG-TP5
message.comment: This message is used to get/set time pulse parameters. For more information see section Time pulse.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 15

block.name: freqPeriod
block.comment: Frequency or period time, depending on setting of bit 'isFreq'

block.name: freqPeriodLock
block.comment: Frequency or period time when locked to GPS time, only used if 'lockedOtherSet' is set

block.name: pulseLenRatio
block.comment: Pulse length or duty cycle, depending on 'isLength'

block.name: pulseLenRatioLock
block.comment: Pulse length or duty cycle when locked to GPS time, only used if 'lockedOtherSet' is set

type.name: active
type.description: if set enable time pulse; if pin assigned to another function, other function takes precedence

type.name: lockGpsFreq
type.description: if set synchronize time pulse to GPS as soon as GPS time is valid, otherwise use local clock

type.name: lockedOtherSet
type.description: if set use 'freqPeriodLock' and 'pulseLenRatioLock' as soon as GPS time is valid and 'freqPeriod' and 'pulseLenRatio' if GPS time is invalid, if flag is cleared 'freqPeriod' and 'pulseLenRatio' used regardless of GPS time

type.name: isFreq
type.description: if set 'freqPeriodLock' and 'freqPeriod' interpreted as frequency, otherwise interpreted as period

type.name: isLength
type.description: if set 'pulseLenRatioLock' and 'pulseLenRatio' interpreted as pulse length, otherwise interpreted as duty cycle

type.name: alignToTow
type.description: align pulse to top of second (period time must be integer fraction of 1s)

type.name: polarity
type.description: pulse polarity: 0 = falling edge at top of second 1 = rising edge at top of second

type.name: gridUtcGps
type.description: timegrid to use: 0 = UTC 1 = GPS

block.name: freqPeriod
block.comment: Frequency or period time, depending on setting of bit 'isFreq'

block.name: freqPeriodLock
block.comment: Frequency or period time when locked to GNSS time, only used if 'lockedOtherSet' is set

block.name: pulseLenRatio
block.comment: Pulse length or duty cycle, depending on 'isLength'

block.name: pulseLenRatioLock
block.comment: Pulse length or duty cycle when locked to GNSS time, only used if 'lockedOtherSet' is set

type.name: active
type.description: If set enable time pulse; if pin assigned to another function, other function takes precedence. Must be set for FTS variant.

type.name: lockGnssFreq
type.description: If set, synchronize time pulse to GNSS as soon as GNSS time is valid. If not set, or before GNSS time is valid, use local clock. This flag is ignored by the FTS product variant; in this case the receiver always locks to the best available time/frequency reference (which is not necessarily GNSS). This flag can be unset only in Timing product variants.

type.name: lockedOtherSet
type.description: If set the receiver switches between the timepulse settings given by 'freqPeriodLocked' & 'pulseLenLocked' and those given by 'freqPeriod' & 'pulseLen'. The 'Locked' settings are used where the receiver has an accurate sense of time. For non-FTS products, this occurs when GNSS solution with a reliable time is available, but for FTS products the setting syncMode field governs behavior. In all cases, the receiver only uses 'freqPeriod' & 'pulseLen' when the flag is unset.

type.name: isFreq
type.description: If set 'freqPeriodLock' and 'freqPeriod' are interpreted as frequency, otherwise interpreted as period.

type.name: isLength
type.description: If set 'pulseLenRatioLock' and 'pulseLenRatio' interpreted as pulse length, otherwise interpreted as duty cycle.

type.name: alignToTow
type.description: Align pulse to top of second (period time must be integer fraction of 1s). Also set 'lockGnssFreq' to use this feature. This flag is ignored by the FTS product variant; it is assumed to be always set (as is lockGnssFreq). Set maxSlewRate and maxPhaseCorrRate fields of UBX-CFG-SMGR to 0 to disable alignment.

type.name: polarity
type.description: Pulse polarity: 0: falling edge at top of second 1: rising edge at top of second

type.name: gridUtcGnss
type.description: Timegrid to use: 0: UTC 1: GPS 2: GLONASS 3: BeiDou 4: Galileo (not supported in protocol versions less than 18) This flag is only relevant if 'lockGnssFreq' and 'alignToTow' are set. Note that configured GNSS time is estimated by the receiver if locked to any GNSS system. If the receiver has a valid GNSS fix it will attempt to steer the TP to the specified time grid even if the specified time is not based on information from the constellation's satellites. To ensure timing based purely on a given GNSS, restrict the supported constellations in UBX-CFG-GNSS.

type.name: syncMode
type.description: Sync Manager lock mode to use: 0: switch to 'freqPeriodLock' and 'pulseLenRatioLock' as soon as Sync Manager has an accurate time, never switch back to 'freqPeriod' and 'pulseLenRatio' 1: switch to 'freqPeriodLock' and 'pulseLenRatioLock' as soon as Sync Manager has an accurate time, and switch back to 'freqPeriod' and 'pulseLenRatio' as soon as time gets inaccurate This field is only relevant for the FTS product variant. This field is only relevant if the flag 'lockedOtherSet' is set.

message.name: UBX-CFG-TXSLOT
message.comment: This message configures how transmit time slots are defined for the receiver interfaces. These time slots are relative to the chosen time pulse. A receiver that supports this message offers 3 time slots: nr. 0, 1 and 2. These time pulses follow each other and their associated priorities decrease in this order. The end of each can be specified in this message, the beginning is when the circularly previous slot ends (i.e. slot 0 starts when slot 2 finishes).
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: enable
block.comment: Bitfield of ports for which the slots are enabled.

type.name: DDC
type.description: DDC/I2C

type.name: UART1
type.description: UART 1

type.name: UART2
type.description: UART 2

type.name: USB
type.description: USB

type.name: SPI
type.description: SPI

block.name: end
block.comment: End of timeslot in milliseconds after time pulse

block.name: vendorID
block.comment: Vendor ID. This field shall only be set to registered Vendor IDs. Changing this field requires special Host drivers.

block.name: productID
block.comment: Product ID. Changing this field requires special Host drivers.

type.name: reEnum
type.description: force re-enumeration

type.name: powerMode
type.description: self-powered (1), bus-powered (0)

block.name: vendorString
block.comment: String containing the vendor name. 32 ASCII bytes including 0-termination.

block.name: productString
block.comment: String containing the product name. 32 ASCII bytes including 0-termination.

block.name: serialNumber
block.comment: String containing the serial number. 32 ASCII bytes including 0-termination. Changing the String fields requires special Host drivers.

message.name: UBX-ESF-INS
message.comment: This message outputs information about the vehicle dynamics. For ADR products (in protocol versions less than 19.2), the output dynamics information (angular rates and accelerations) is expressed with respect to the vehicle-frame. More information can be found in the ADR Navigation Output section. For ADR products, the output dynamics information (angular rates and accelerations) is expressed with respect to the vehicle-frame. More information can be found in the ADR Navigation Output section. For UDR products, the output dynamics information (angular rates and accelerations) are expressed with respect to the body-frame. More information can be found in the UDR Navigation Output section.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

type.name: version
type.description: Message version (0x01 for this version)

type.name: xAngRateValid
type.description: Compensated x-axis angular rate data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: yAngRateValid
type.description: Compensated y-axis angular rate data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: zAngRateValid
type.description: Compensated z-axis angular rate data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: xAccelValid
type.description: Compensated x-axis acceleration data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: yAccelValid
type.description: Compensated y-axis acceleration data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: zAccelValid
type.description: Compensated z-axis acceleration data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-ESF-MEAS
message.comment: Possible data types for the data field are described in the ESF Measurement Data section.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15.01, 16 and 17 (only with ADR products) u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

block.name: timeTag
block.comment: Time tag of measurement generated by external sensor

block.name: flags
block.comment: Flags. Set all unused bits to zero.

type.name: timeMarkSent
type.description: Time mark signal was supplied just prior to sending this message: 0 = none, 1 = on Ext0, 2 = on Ext1

type.name: timeMarkEdge
type.description: Trigger on rising (0) or falling (1) edge of time mark signal

type.name: calibTtagValid
type.description: Calibration time tag available. Always set to zero.

type.name: numMeas
type.description: Number of measurements contained in this message (optional, can be obtained from message size)

type.name: dataField
type.description: Data

type.name: dataType
type.description: Type of data (0 = no data; 1..63 = data type)

block.name: calibTtag
block.comment: Receiver local time calibrated. This field must not be supplied when calibTtagValid is set to 0.

message.name: UBX-ESF-RAW
message.comment: The message contains measurements from the active inertial sensors connected to the GNSS chip. Possible data types for the data field are accelerometer, gyroscope and temperature readings as described in the ESF Measurement Data section. Note that the rate selected in UBX-CFG-MSG is not respected. If a positive rate is selected then all raw measurements will be output. See also Raw Sensor Measurement Data.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15.01, 16 and 17 (only with ADR products) u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

type.name: dataField
type.description: data

type.name: dataType
type.description: type of data (0 = no data; 1..255 = data type)

message.name: UBX-ESF-STATUS
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15.01, 16 and 17 (only with ADR products) u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: fusionMode
block.comment: Fusion mode: 0: Initialization mode: receiver is initializing some unknown values required for doing sensor fusion 1: Fusion mode: GNSS and sensor data are used for navigation solution computation 2: Suspended fusion mode: sensor fusion is temporarily disabled due to e.g. invalid sensor data or detected ferry 3: Disabled fusion mode: sensor fusion is permanently disabled until receiver reset due e.g. to sensor error More details can be found in the Fusion Modes section.

type.name: type
type.description: Sensor data type. See section Sensor data types in the Integration manual for details.

type.name: used
type.description: If set, sensor data is used for the current sensor fusion solution.

type.name: ready
type.description: If set, sensor is set up (configuration is available or not required) but not used for computing the current sensor fusion solution.

type.name: calibStatus
type.description: 00: Sensor is not calibrated 01: Sensor is calibrating 10/11: Sensor is calibrated Good dead reckoning performance is only possible when all used sensors are calibrated. Depending on the quality of the GNSS signals and the sensor data, the sensors may take a longer time to get calibrated.

type.name: timeStatus
type.description: 00: No data 01: Reception of the first byte used to tag the measurement 10: Event input used to tag the measurement 11: Time tag provided with the data

type.name: badMeas
type.description: Bad measurements detected

type.name: badTTag
type.description: Bad measurement time-tags detected

type.name: missingMeas
type.description: Missing or time-misaligned measurements detected

type.name: noisyMeas
type.description: High measurement noise-level detected

message.name: UBX-HNR-INS
message.comment: This message outputs high rate information about vehicle dynamics computed by the Inertial Navigation System (INS) during ESF-based navigation. For ADR products (in protocol versions less than 19.2), the output dynamics information (angular rates and accelerations) is expressed with respect to the vehicle-frame. More information can be found in the ADR Navigation Output section. For UDR products, the output dynamics information (angular rates and accelerations) is expressed with respect to the body-frame. More information can be found in the UDR Navigation Output section. For ADR products, the output dynamics information (angular rates and accelerations) is expressed with respect to the vehicle-frame. More information can be found in the ADR Navigation Output section.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

type.name: version
type.description: Message version (0x00 for this version)

type.name: xAngRateValid
type.description: Compensated x-axis angular rate data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: yAngRateValid
type.description: Compensated y-axis angular rate data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: zAngRateValid
type.description: Compensated z-axis angular rate data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: xAccelValid
type.description: Compensated x-axis acceleration data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: yAccelValid
type.description: Compensated y-axis acceleration data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

type.name: zAccelValid
type.description: Compensated z-axis acceleration data validity flag (0: not valid, 1: valid).

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the HNR epoch.

message.name: UBX-HNR-PVT
message.description: High rate output of PVT solution
message.comment: This message provides the position, velocity and time solution with high output rate. Note that during a leap second there may be more or less than 60 seconds in a minute. See the description of leap seconds for details.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

type.name: validDate
type.description: 1 = Valid UTC Date (see Integration manual Time Validity section for details)

type.name: validTime
type.description: 1 = Valid UTC Time of Day (see Integration manual Time Validity section for details)

type.name: fullyResolved
type.description: 1 = UTC Time of Day has been fully resolved (no seconds uncertainty)

block.name: gpsFix
block.comment: GPSfix Type, range 0..5 0x00 = No Fix 0x01 = Dead Reckoning only 0x02 = 2D-Fix 0x03 = 3D-Fix 0x04 = GPS + dead reckoning combined 0x05 = Time only fix 0x06..0xff: reserved

type.name: GPSfixOK
type.description: >1 = Fix within limits (e.g. DOP & accuracy)

type.name: DiffSoln
type.description: 1 = DGPS used

type.name: WKNSET
type.description: 1 = Valid GPS week number

type.name: TOWSET
type.description: 1 = Valid GPS time of week (iTOW & fTOW)

type.name: headVehValid
type.description: 1= Heading of vehicle is valid

message.name: UBX-INF-DEBUG
message.comment: This message has a variable length payload, representing an ASCII string.

message.name: UBX-INF-ERROR
message.comment: This message has a variable length payload, representing an ASCII string.

message.name: UBX-INF-NOTICE
message.comment: This message has a variable length payload, representing an ASCII string.

message.name: UBX-INF-TEST
message.comment: This message has a variable length payload, representing an ASCII string.

message.name: UBX-INF-WARNING
message.comment: This message has a variable length payload, representing an ASCII string.

message.name: UBX-LOG-BATCH
message.comment: This message combines position, velocity and time solution, including accuracy figures. The output of this message can be requested via UBX-LOG-RETRIEVEBATCH. The content of this message is influenced by UBX-CFG-BATCH. Depending on the flags extraPvt and extraOdo some of the fields in this message may not be valid. This validity information is also indicated in this message via flags of the same name. See Data Batching for more information. Note that during a leap second there may be more or less than 60 seconds in a minute. See the description of leap seconds for details.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 23.01

type.name: extraPvt
type.description: Store extra PVT information The fields iTOW, tAcc, numSV, hMSL, vAcc, velN, velE, velD, sAcc, headAcc and pDOP are only valid if this flag is set.

type.name: extraOdo
type.description: Store odometer data The fields distance, totalDistance and distanceStd are only valid if this flag is set. Note: the odometer feature itself must also be enabled.

block.name: msgCnt
block.comment: Message counter; increments for each sent UBX-LOG-BATCH message.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details. Only valid if extraPvt is set.

type.name: validDate
type.description: 1 = valid UTC Date (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: validTime
type.description: 1 = valid UTC Time of Day (see Time Validity section for details)

block.name: tAcc
block.comment: Time accuracy estimate (UTC) Only valid if extraPvt is set.

type.name: gnssFixOK
type.description: 1 = valid fix (i.e within DOP & accuracy masks)

type.name: diffSoln
type.description: 1 = differential corrections were applied

type.name: psmState
type.description: Power save mode state (see Power Management) 0: PSM is not active 1: Enabled (an intermediate state before Acquisition state) 2: Acquisition 3: Tracking 4: Power optimized tracking 5: Inactive

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Number of satellites used in Nav Solution Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: hMSL
block.comment: Height above mean sea level Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: vAcc
block.comment: Vertical accuracy estimate Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: velN
block.comment: NED north velocity Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: velE
block.comment: NED east velocity Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: velD
block.comment: NED down velocity Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: sAcc
block.comment: Speed accuracy estimate Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: headAcc
block.comment: Heading accuracy estimate Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: pDOP
block.comment: Position DOP Only valid if extraPvt is set.

block.name: distance
block.comment: Ground distance since last reset Only valid if extraOdo is set.

block.name: totalDistance
block.comment: Total cumulative ground distance Only valid if extraOdo is set.

block.name: distanceStd
block.comment: Ground distance accuracy (1-sigma) Only valid if extraOdo is set.

message.name: UBX-LOG-CREATE
message.comment: This message is used to create an initial logging file and activate the logging subsystem. UBX-ACK-ACK or UBX-ACK-NAK are returned to indicate success or failure. This message does not handle activation of recording or filtering of log entries (see UBX-CFG-LOGFILTER).

type.name: circular
type.description: Log is circular (new entries overwrite old ones in a full log) if this bit set

block.name: logSize
block.comment: Indicates the size of the log: 0 (maximum safe size): Ensures that logging will not be interrupted and enough space will be left available for all other uses of the filestore 1 (minimum size): 2 (user-defined): See 'userDefinedSize' below

block.name: userDefinedSize
block.comment: Sets the maximum amount of space in the filestore that can be used by the logging task. This field is only applicable if logSize is set to user-defined.

message.name: UBX-LOG-ERASE
message.comment: This message deactivates the logging system and erases all logged data. UBX-ACK-ACK or UBX-ACK-NAK are returned to indicate success or failure.

message.name: UBX-LOG-FINDTIME
message.description: Find index of a log entry based on a given time
message.comment: This message can be used for a time-based search of a log. It can find the index of the first log entry with time equal to the given time, otherwise the index of the most recent entry with time less than the given time. This index can then be used with the UBX-LOG-RETRIEVE message to provide time-based retrieval of log entries. Searching a log is effective for a given time later than the base date (January 1st, 2004). Searching a log for a given time earlier than the base date will result in an 'entry not found' response. (Searching a log for a given time earlier than the base date will result in a UBX-ACK-NAK message in protocol versions less than 18). Searching a log for a given time greater than the last recorded entry's time will return the index of the last recorded entry. (If the logging has stopped due to lack of file space, such a search will result in a UBX-ACK-NAK message in protocol versions less than 18).

block.name: entryNumber
block.comment: Index of the first log entry with time = given time, otherwise index of the most recent entry with time < given time. If 0xFFFFFFFF, no log entry found with time <= given time. The indexing of log entries is zero-based.

message.name: UBX-LOG-INFO
message.comment: Upon sending of this message, the receiver returns UBX-LOG-INFO as defined below.

message.name: UBX-LOG-INFO
message.comment: This message is used to report information about the logging subsystem. Note: The reported maximum log size will be smaller than that originally specified in LOG-CREATE due to logging and filestore implementation overheads. Log entries are compressed in a variable length fashion, so it may be difficult to predict log space usage with any precision. There may be times when the receiver does not have an accurate time (e.g. if the week number is not yet known), in which case some entries will not have a timestamp. This may result in the oldest/newest entry time values not taking account of these entries.

block.name: currentMaxLogSize
block.comment: The maximum size the current log is allowed to grow to

block.name: currentLogSize
block.comment: Approximate amount of space in log currently occupied

block.name: entryCount
block.comment: Number of entries in the log. Note: for circular logs this value will decrease when a group of entries is deleted to make space for new ones.

block.name: oldestYear
block.comment: Oldest entry UTC year (1-65635) or zero if there are no entries with known time

block.name: newestYear
block.comment: Newest year (1-65635) or zero if there are no entries with known time

type.name: recording
type.description: Log entry recording is currently turned on

type.name: inactive
type.description: Logging system not active - no log present

type.name: circular
type.description: The current log is circular

message.name: UBX-LOG-RETRIEVEBATCH
message.comment: This message is used to request batched data. Batch entries are returned in chronological order, using one UBX-LOG-BATCH per navigation epoch. The speed of transfer can be maximized by using a high data rate. See Data Batching for more information.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 23.01

type.name: sendMonFirst
type.description: Send UBX-MON-BATCH message before sending the UBX-LOG-BATCH message(s).

message.name: UBX-LOG-RETRIEVEPOSEXTRA
message.comment: This message is used to report an odometer log entry

block.name: entryIndex
block.comment: The index of this log entry

block.name: year
block.comment: Year (1-65635) of UTC time. Will be zero if time not known

block.name: distance
block.comment: Odometer distance traveled since the last time the odometer was reset by a UBX- NAV-RESETODO

message.name: UBX-LOG-RETRIEVEPOS
message.comment: This message is used to report a position fix log entry

block.name: entryIndex
block.comment: The index of this log entry

block.name: fixType
block.comment: Fix type: 0x01: Dead Reckoning only 0x02: 2D-Fix 0x03: 3D-Fix 0x04: GNSS + Dead Reckoning combined

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Number of satellites used in the position fix

message.name: UBX-LOG-RETRIEVESTRING
message.comment: This message is used to report a byte string log entry

block.name: entryIndex
block.comment: The index of this log entry

block.name: year
block.comment: Year (1-65635) of UTC time. Will be zero if time not known

message.name: UBX-LOG-RETRIEVE
message.comment: This message is used to request logged data (log recording must first be disabled, see UBX-CFG-LOGFILTER). Log entries are returned in chronological order, using the messages UBX-LOG- RETRIEVEPOS and UBX-LOG-RETRIEVESTRING. If the odometer was enabled at the time a position was logged, then message UBX-LOG-RETRIEVEPOSEXTRA will also be used. The maximum number of entries that can be returned in response to a single UBX-LOG-RETRIEVE message is 256. If more entries than this are required the message will need to be sent multiple times with different startNumbers. The retrieve will be stopped if any UBX-LOG message is received. The speed of transfer can be maximized by using a high data rate and temporarily stopping the GPS processing (see UBX-CFG-RST).

block.name: startNumber
block.comment: Index of first log entry to be transferred. If it is larger than the index of the last available log entry, then the first log entry to be transferred is the last available log entry. The indexing of log entries is zero- based.

block.name: entryCount
block.comment: Number of log entries to transfer in total including the first entry to be transferred. If it is larger than the log entries available starting from the first entry to be transferred, then only the available log entries are transferred followed by a UBX- ACK-NAK. The maximum is 256.

message.name: UBX-LOG-STRING
message.description: Store arbitrary string in on-board flash
message.comment: This message can be used to store an arbitrary byte string in the on-board flash memory. The maximum length that can be stored is 256 bytes.

block.name: bytes
block.comment: The string of bytes to be logged (maximum 256)

message.name: UBX-MGA-ACK-DATA0
message.comment: This message is sent by a u-blox receiver to acknowledge the receipt of an assistance message. Acknowledgments are enabled by setting the ackAiding parameter in the UBX- CFG-NAVX5 message. See the description of flow control for details.

block.name: type
block.comment: Type of acknowledgment: 0: The message was not used by the receiver (see infoCode field for an indication of why) 1: The message was accepted for use by the receiver (the infoCode field will be 0)

block.name: infoCode
block.comment: Provides greater information on what the receiver chose to do with the message contents: 0: The receiver accepted the data 1: The receiver does not know the time so it cannot use the data (To resolve this a UBX-MGA-INI-TIME_UTC message should be supplied first) 2: The message version is not supported by the receiver 3: The message size does not match the message version 4: The message data could not be stored to the database 5: The receiver is not ready to use the message data 6: The message type is unknown

block.name: msgId
block.comment: UBX message ID of the acknowledged message

block.name: msgPayloadStart
block.comment: The first 4 bytes of the acknowledged message's payload

message.name: UBX-MGA-ANO
message.comment: This message is created by the AssistNow Offline service to deliver AssistNow Offline assistance to the receiver. See the description of AssistNow Offline for details.

message.name: UBX-MGA-BDS-EPH
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of BeiDou ephemeris assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: Deltan
block.comment: Mean motion difference from computed value

block.name: Omega0
block.comment: Longitude of ascending node of orbital of plane computed according to reference time

block.name: Cuc
block.comment: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

block.name: Cus
block.comment: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

block.name: Crc
block.comment: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

block.name: Crs
block.comment: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

block.name: Cic
block.comment: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

block.name: Cis
block.comment: Amplitude of sine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

message.name: UBX-MGA-BDS-ALM
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of BeiDou almanac assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: deltaI
block.comment: Almanac correction of orbit reference inclination at reference time

block.name: sqrtA
block.comment: Almanac square root of semi-major axis

block.name: M0
block.comment: Almanac mean anomaly at reference time

block.name: Omega0
block.comment: Almanac longitude of ascending node of orbit plane at computed according to reference time

message.name: UBX-MGA-BDS-HEALTH
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of BeiDou health assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: healthCode
block.comment: Each two-byte value represents a BeiDou SV (1-30). The 9 LSBs of each byte contain the 9 bit health code from subframe 5 pages 7,8 of the D1 message, and from subframe 5 pages 35,36 of the D1 message.

message.name: UBX-MGA-BDS-UTC
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of BeiDou UTC assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: a0UTC
block.comment: BDT clock bias relative to UTC

block.name: a1UTC
block.comment: BDT clock rate relative to UTC

block.name: dtLS
block.comment: Delta time due to leap seconds before the new leap second effective

block.name: wnRec
block.comment: BeiDou week number of reception of this UTC parameter set (8-bit truncated)

block.name: wnLSF
block.comment: Week number of the new leap second

block.name: dN
block.comment: Day number of the new leap second

block.name: dtLSF
block.comment: Delta time due to leap seconds after the new leap second effective

message.name: UBX-MGA-BDS-IONO
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of BeiDou ionospheric assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

message.name: UBX-MGA-DBD
message.comment: Poll the whole navigation data base. The receiver will send all available data from its internal database. The receiver will indicate the finish of the transmission with a UBX-MGA-ACK. The msgPayloadStart field of the UBX-MGA-ACK message will contain a U4 representing the number of UBX-MGA-DBD-DATA* messages sent.

message.name: UBX-MGA-DBD
message.comment: UBX-MGA-DBD messages are only intended to be sent back to the same receiver that generated them. Navigation database entry. The data fields are firmware-specific. Transmission of this type of message will be acknowledged by UBX-MGA-ACK messages, if acknowledgment has been enabled. See the description of flow control for details. The maximum payload size for firmware 2.01 onwards is 164 bytes (which makes the maximum message size 172 bytes).

message.name: UBX-MGA-FLASH-DATA
message.description: Transfer MGA-ANO data block to flash
message.comment: This message is used to transfer a block of MGA-ANO data from host to the receiver. Upon reception of this message, the receiver will write the payload data to its internal non-volatile memory (flash). Also, on reception of the first MGA- FLASH-DATA message, the receiver will erase the flash allocated to storing any existing MGA-ANO data. The payload can be up to 512 bytes. Payloads larger than this would exceed the receiver's internal buffering capabilities. The receiver will ACK/NACK this message using the message alternatives given below. The host shall wait for an acknowledge message before sending the next data block. See Flash-based AssistNow Offline for details.

block.name: sequence
block.comment: Message sequence number, starting at 0 and increamenting by 1 for each MGA- FLASH-DATA message sent.

message.name: UBX-MGA-FLASH-STOP
message.comment: This message is used to tell the receiver that there are no more MGA-FLASH type 1 messages coming, and that it can do any final internal operations needed to commit the data to flash as a background activity. A UBX-MGA-ACK message will be sent at the end of this process. Note that there may be a delay of several seconds before the UBX-MGA-ACK for this message is sent because of the time taken for this processing. See Flash-based AssistNow Offline for details.

message.name: UBX-MGA-FLASH-ACK
message.comment: This message reports an ACK/NACK to the host for the last MGA-FLASH type 1 or type 2 message message received. See Flash-based AssistNow Offline for details.

block.name: ack
block.comment: Acknowledgment type. 0 - ACK: Message received and written to flash. 1 - NACK: Problem with last message, re- transmission required (this only happens while acknowledging a UBX-MGA_FLASH_ DATA message). 2 - NACK: problem with last message, give up.

block.name: sequence
block.comment: If acknowledging a UBX-MGA-FLASH- DATA message this is the Message sequence number being ack'ed. If acknowledging a UBX-MGA-FLASH-STOP message it will be set to 0xffff.

message.name: UBX-MGA-GAL-EPH
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of Galileo ephemeris assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: iodNav
block.comment: Ephemeris and clock correction Issue of Data

block.name: deltaN
block.comment: Mean motion difference from computed value

block.name: sqrtA
block.comment: Square root of the semi-major axis

block.name: omega0
block.comment: Longitude of ascending node of orbital plane at weekly epoch

block.name: omegaDot
block.comment: Rate of change of right ascension

block.name: iDot
block.comment: Rate of change of inclination angle

block.name: cuc
block.comment: Amplitude of the cosine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

block.name: cus
block.comment: Amplitude of the sine harmonic correction term to the argument of latitude

block.name: crc
block.comment: Amplitude of the cosine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

block.name: crs
block.comment: Amplitude of the sine harmonic correction term to the orbit radius

block.name: cic
block.comment: Amplitude of the cosine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

block.name: cis
block.comment: Amplitude of the sine harmonic correction term to the angle of inclination

block.name: af2
block.comment: SV clock drift rate correction coefficient

block.name: sisaIndexE1E5b
block.comment: Signal-In-Space Accuracy index for dual frequency E1-E5b

block.name: toc
block.comment: Clock correction data reference Time of Week

message.name: UBX-MGA-GAL-ALM
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of Galileo almanac assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: deltaSqrtA
block.comment: Difference with respect to the square root of the nominal semi-major axis (29 600 km)

block.name: deltaI
block.comment: Inclination at reference time relative to i0 = 56 degree

block.name: omega0
block.comment: Longitude of ascending node of orbital plane at weekly epoch

block.name: omegaDot
block.comment: Rate of change of right ascension

block.name: m0
block.comment: Satellite mean anomaly at reference time

message.name: UBX-MGA-GAL-TIMEOFFSET
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of Galileo time to GPS time offset. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: a0G
block.comment: Constant term of the polynomial describing the offset

block.name: a1G
block.comment: Rate of change of the offset

message.name: UBX-MGA-GAL-UTC
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of Galileo UTC assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: dtLS
block.comment: Delta time due to current leap seconds

block.name: tot
block.comment: UTC parameters reference time of week (Galileo time)

block.name: wnt
block.comment: UTC parameters reference week number (the 8-bit WNt field)

block.name: wnLSF
block.comment: Week number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective (the 8-bit WNLSF field)

block.name: dN
block.comment: Day number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective

block.name: dTLSF
block.comment: Delta time due to future leap seconds

message.name: UBX-MGA-GLO-EPH
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of GLONASS ephemeris assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: M
block.comment: Type of GLONASS satellite (1 indicates GLONASS-M)

block.name: H
block.comment: Carrier frequency number of navigation RF signal, Range=(-7 .. 6), -128 for unknown

block.name: x
block.comment: X component of the SV position in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

block.name: y
block.comment: Y component of the SV position in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

block.name: z
block.comment: Z component of the SV position in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

block.name: dx
block.comment: X component of the SV velocity in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

block.name: dy
block.comment: Y component of the SV velocity in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

block.name: dz
block.comment: Z component of the SV velocity in PZ-90. 02 coordinate System

block.name: ddx
block.comment: X component of the SV acceleration in PZ- 90.02 coordinate System

block.name: ddy
block.comment: Y component of the SV acceleration in PZ- 90.02 coordinate System

block.name: ddz
block.comment: Z component of the SV acceleration in PZ- 90.02 coordinate System

block.name: tb
block.comment: Index of a time interval within current day according to UTC(SU)

block.name: deltaTau
block.comment: Time difference between L2 and L1 band

message.name: UBX-MGA-GLO-ALM
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of GLONASS almanac assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: N
block.comment: Reference calender day number of almanac within the four-year period (from string 5)

block.name: M
block.comment: Type of GLONASS satellite (1 indicates GLONASS-M)

block.name: C
block.comment: Unhealthy flag at instant of almanac upload (1 indicates operability of satellite)

block.name: tau
block.comment: Coarse time correction to GLONASS time

block.name: lambda
block.comment: Longitude of the first (within the N-day) ascending node of satellite orbit in PC-90. 02 coordinate system

block.name: deltaI
block.comment: Correction to the mean value of inclination

block.name: tLambda
block.comment: Time of the first ascending node passage

block.name: deltaT
block.comment: Correction to the mean value of Draconian period

block.name: deltaDT
block.comment: Rate of change of Draconian period

block.name: H
block.comment: Carrier frequency number of navigation RF signal, Range=(-7 .. 6)

message.name: UBX-MGA-GLO-TIMEOFFSET
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of auxiliary GLONASS assistance (including the GLONASS time offsets to other GNSS systems) to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: N
block.comment: Reference calendar day number within the four-year period of almanac (from string 5)

block.name: tauC
block.comment: Time scale correction to UTC(SU) time

block.name: tauGps
block.comment: Correction to GPS time relative to GLONASS time

block.name: B2
block.comment: Rate of change of delta UT1

message.comment: This message allows the delivery of GPS ephemeris assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: deltaN

block.name: cuc
block.comment: Amplitude of cosine harmonic correction term to argument of latitude

block.name: cus

block.name: sqrtA

block.name: cic

block.name: omega0
block.comment: Longitude of ascending node of orbit plane at weekly epoch

block.name: cis

block.name: crc

block.name: healthCode
block.comment: Each byte represents a GPS SV (1-32). The 6 LSBs of each byte contains the 6 bit health code from subframes 4/5 page 25.

message.name: UBX-MGA-GPS-UTC
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of GPS UTC assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: utcDtLS
block.comment: Delta time due to current leap seconds

block.name: utcTot
block.comment: UTC parameters reference time of week (GPS time)

block.name: utcWNt
block.comment: UTC parameters reference week number (the 8-bit WNt field)

block.name: utcWNlsf
block.comment: Week number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective (the 8-bit WNLSF field)

block.name: utcDn
block.comment: Day number at the end of which the future leap second becomes effective

block.name: utcDtLSF
block.comment: Delta time due to future leap seconds

message.name: UBX-MGA-GPS-IONO
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of GPS ionospheric assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

message.name: UBX-MGA-INI-POS_XYZ
message.comment: Supplying position assistance that is inaccurate by more than the specified position accuracy, may lead to substantially degraded receiver performance. This message allows the delivery of initial position assistance to a receiver in cartesian ECEF coordinates. This message is equivalent to the UBX-MGA-INI- POS_LLH message, except for the coordinate system. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

message.name: UBX-MGA-INI-POS_LLH
message.comment: Supplying position assistance that is inaccurate by more than the specified position accuracy, may lead to substantially degraded receiver performance. This message allows the delivery of initial position assistance to a receiver in WGS84 lat/long/alt coordinates. This message is equivalent to the UBX-MGA- INI-POS_XYZ message, except for the coordinate system. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

message.name: UBX-MGA-INI-TIME_UTC
message.comment: Supplying time assistance that is inaccurate by more than the specified time accuracy, may lead to substantially degraded receiver performance. This message allows the delivery of UTC time assistance to a receiver. This message is equivalent to the UBX-MGA-INI-TIME_GNSS message, except for the time base. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: ref
block.comment: Reference to be used to set time

type.name: source
type.description: 0: none, i.e. on receipt of message (will be inaccurate!) 1: relative to pulse sent to EXTINT0 2: relative to pulse sent to EXTINT1 3-15: reserved

type.name: fall
type.description: use falling edge of EXTINT pulse (default rising) - only if source is EXTINT

type.name: last
type.description: use last EXTINT pulse (default next pulse) - only if source is EXTINT

block.name: leapSecs
block.comment: Number of leap seconds since 1980 (or 0x80 = -128 if unknown)

block.name: tAccNs
block.comment: Nanoseconds part of time accuracy, from 0 to 999,999,999

message.name: UBX-MGA-INI-TIME_GNSS
message.comment: Supplying time assistance that is inaccurate by more than the specified time accuracy, may lead to substantially degraded receiver performance. This message allows the delivery of time assistance to a receiver in a chosen GNSS timebase. This message is equivalent to the UBX-MGA-INI-TIME_UTC message, except for the time base. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: ref
block.comment: Reference to be used to set time

type.name: source
type.description: 0: none, i.e. on receipt of message (will be inaccurate!) 1: relative to pulse sent to EXTINT0 2: relative to pulse sent to EXTINT1 3-15: reserved

type.name: fall
type.description: use falling edge of EXTINT pulse (default rising) - only if source is EXTINT

type.name: last
type.description: use last EXTINT pulse (default next pulse) - only if source is EXTINT

block.name: gnssId
block.comment: Source of time information. Currently supported: 0: GPS time 2: Galileo time 3: BeiDou time 6: GLONASS time: week = 834 + ((N4- 1)*1461 + Nt)/7, tow = (((N4-1)*1461 + Nt) % 7) * 86400 + tod

block.name: ns
block.comment: GNSS time of week, nanosecond part from 0 to 999,999,999

block.name: tAccNs
block.comment: Nanoseconds part of time accuracy, from 0 to 999,999,999

message.name: UBX-MGA-INI-CLKD
message.comment: Supplying clock drift assistance that is inaccurate by more than the specified accuracy, may lead to substantially degraded receiver performance. This message allows the delivery of clock drift assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

message.name: UBX-MGA-INI-FREQ
message.comment: Supplying external frequency assistance that is inaccurate by more than the specified accuracy, may lead to substantially degraded receiver performance. This message allows the delivery of external frequency assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

type.name: source
type.description: 0: frequency available on EXTINT0 1: frequency available on EXTINT1 2-15: reserved

type.name: fall
type.description: use falling edge of EXTINT pulse (default rising)

message.name: UBX-MGA-INI-EOP
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of new earth orientation parameters (EOP) to a receiver to improve AssistNow Autonomous operation.

block.name: deltaN

block.name: cuc
block.comment: Amp of cosine harmonic corr term to arg of lat

block.name: cus
block.comment: Amp of sine harmonic corr term to arg of lat

block.name: sqrtA
block.comment: Square root of the semi-major axis A

block.name: cic
block.comment: Amp of cos harmonic corr term to angle of inclination

block.name: omega0
block.comment: Long of asc node of orbit plane at weekly epoch

block.name: cis
block.comment: Amp of sine harmonic corr term to angle of inclination

block.name: crc
block.comment: Amp of cosine harmonic corr term to orbit radius

message.name: UBX-MGA-QZSS-ALM
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of QZSS almanac assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: svId
block.comment: QZSS Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering), Range 1-5

block.name: almWNa
block.comment: Reference week number of almanac (the 8-bit WNa field)

block.name: deltaI
block.comment: Delta inclination angle at reference time

block.name: sqrtA
block.comment: Almanac square root of the semi-major axis A

block.name: omega0
block.comment: Almanac long of asc node of orbit plane at weekly

block.name: m0
