message.name: UBX-MGA-QZSS-HEALTH
message.comment: This message allows the delivery of QZSS health assistance to a receiver. See the description of AssistNow Online for details.

block.name: healthCode
block.comment: Each byte represents a QZSS SV (1-5). The 6 LSBs of each byte contains the 6 bit health code from subframes 4/5, data ID = 3, SV ID = 51

message.name: UBX-MON-BATCH
message.comment: This message contains status information about the batching buffer. It can be polled and it can also be sent by the receiver as a response to a UBX- LOG-RETRIEVEBATCH message before the UBX-LOG-BATCH messages. See Data Batching for more information.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 23.01

block.name: fillLevel
block.comment: Current buffer fill level, i.e. number of epochs currently stored

block.name: dropsAll
block.comment: Number of dropped epochs since startup Note: changing the batching configuration will reset this counter.

block.name: dropsSinceMon
block.comment: Number of dropped epochs since last MON-BATCH message

block.name: nextMsgCnt
block.comment: The next retrieved UBX-LOG-BATCH will have this msgCnt value.

message.name: UBX-MON-GNSS
message.comment: This message reports major GNSS selection. It does this by means of bit masks in U1 fields. Each bit in a bit mask corresponds to one major GNSS. Augmentation systems are not reported.

block.name: supported
block.comment: A bit mask showing the major GNSS that can be supported by this receiver

type.name: GPSSup
type.description: GPS is supported

type.name: GlonassSup
type.description: GLONASS is supported

type.name: BeidouSup
type.description: BeiDou is supported

type.name: GalileoSup
type.description: Galileo is supported

block.name: defaultGnss
block.comment: A bit mask showing the default major GNSS selection. If the default major GNSS selection is currently configured in the efuse for this receiver, it takes precedence over the default major GNSS selection configured in the executing firmware of this receiver.

type.name: GPSDef
type.description: GPS is default-enabled

type.name: GlonassDef
type.description: GLONASS is default-enabled

type.name: BeidouDef
type.description: BeiDou is default-enabled

type.name: GalileoDef
type.description: Galileo is default-enabled

block.name: enabled
block.comment: A bit mask showing the current major GNSS selection enabled for this receiver

type.name: GPSEna
type.description: GPS is enabled

type.name: GlonassEna
type.description: GLONASS is enabled

type.name: BeidouEna
type.description: BeiDou is enabled

type.name: GalileoEna
type.description: Galileo is enabled

block.name: simultaneous
block.comment: Maximum number of concurrent major GNSS that can be supported by this receiver

message.name: UBX-MON-HW2
message.comment: Status of different aspects of the hardware such as Imbalance, Low-Level Configuration and POST Results. The first four parameters of this message represent the complex signal from the RF front end. The following rules of thumb apply: The smaller the absolute value of the variable ofsI and ofsQ, the better. Ideally, the magnitude of the I-part (magI) and the Q-part (magQ) of the complex signal should be the same.

block.name: ofsI
block.comment: Imbalance of I-part of complex signal, scaled (-128 = max. negative imbalance, 127 = max. positive imbalance)

block.name: magI
block.comment: Magnitude of I-part of complex signal, scaled (0 = no signal, 255 = max. magnitude)

block.name: ofsQ
block.comment: Imbalance of Q-part of complex signal, scaled (-128 = max. negative imbalance, 127 = max. positive imbalance)

block.name: magQ
block.comment: Magnitude of Q-part of complex signal, scaled (0 = no signal, 255 = max. magnitude)

block.name: cfgSource
block.comment: Source of low-level configuration (114 = ROM, 111 = OTP, 112 = config pins, 102 = flash image)

block.name: lowLevCfg
block.comment: Low-level configuration (obsolete in protocol versions greater than 15)

message.name: UBX-MON-HW
message.comment: Status of different aspect of the hardware, such as antenna, PIO/peripheral pins, noise level, automatic gain control (AGC)

block.name: pinSel
block.comment: Mask of pins set as peripheral/PIO

block.name: pinBank
block.comment: Mask of pins set as bank A/B

block.name: pinDir
block.comment: Mask of pins set as input/output

block.name: noisePerMS
block.comment: Noise level as measured by the GPS core

block.name: agcCnt
block.comment: AGC monitor (counts SIGHI xor SIGLO, range 0 to 8191)

block.name: aStatus
block.comment: Status of the antenna supervisor state machine (0=INIT, 1=DONTKNOW, 2=OK, 3=SHORT, 4=OPEN)

type.name: rtcCalib
type.description: RTC is calibrated

type.name: safeBoot
type.description: Safeboot mode (0 = inactive, 1 = active)

type.name: jammingState
type.description: Output from jamming/interference monitor (0 = unknown or feature disabled, 1 = ok - no significant jamming, 2 = warning - interference visible but fix OK, 3 = critical - interference visible and no fix)

type.name: xtalAbsent
type.description: RTC xtal has been determined to be absent (not supported in protocol versions less than 18)

block.name: usedMask
block.comment: Mask of pins that are used by the virtual pin manager

block.name: VP
block.comment: Array of pin mappings for each of the 17 physical pins

block.name: jamInd
block.comment: CW jamming indicator, scaled (0 = no CW jamming, 255 = strong CW jamming)

block.name: pinIrq
block.comment: Mask of pins value using the PIO Irq

block.name: pullH
block.comment: Mask of pins value using the PIO pull high resistor

block.name: pullL
block.comment: Mask of pins value using the PIO pull low resistor

message.name: UBX-MON-IO
message.comment: The size of the message is determined by the number of ports 'N' the receiver supports, i.e. on u-blox 5 the number of ports is 6.

block.name: parityErrs
block.comment: Number of 100 ms timeslots with parity errors

block.name: framingErrs
block.comment: Number of 100 ms timeslots with framing errors

block.name: overrunErrs
block.comment: Number of 100 ms timeslots with overrun errors

block.name: breakCond
block.comment: Number of 100 ms timeslots with break conditions

block.name: msg1
block.comment: Number of successfully parsed messages for each protocol on port0

block.name: msg2
block.comment: Number of successfully parsed messages for each protocol on port1

block.name: msg3
block.comment: Number of successfully parsed messages for each protocol on port2

block.name: msg4
block.comment: Number of successfully parsed messages for each protocol on port3

block.name: msg5
block.comment: Number of successfully parsed messages for each protocol on port4

block.name: msg6
block.comment: Number of successfully parsed messages for each protocol on port5

block.name: skipped
block.comment: Number skipped bytes for each port

message.name: UBX-MON-PATCH
message.comment: This message reports information about patches installed and currently enabled on the receiver. It does not report on patches installed and then disabled. An enabled patch is considered active when the receiver executes from the code space where the patch resides on. For example, a ROM patch is reported active only when the system runs from ROM.

block.name: patchInfo
block.comment: Status information about the reported patch

type.name: activated
type.description: 1: the patch is active, 0: otherwise

type.name: location
type.description: Indicates where the patch is stored. 0: eFuse, 1: ROM, 2: BBR, 3: file system

block.name: patchAddress
block.comment: The address that is targeted by the patch

block.name: patchData
block.comment: The data that is inserted at the patchAddress

block.name: pending
block.comment: Number of bytes pending in receiver buffer for each target

block.name: usage
block.comment: Maximum usage receiver buffer during the last sysmon period for each target

block.name: peakUsage
block.comment: Maximum usage receiver buffer for each target

message.name: UBX-MON-RXR
message.comment: The receiver ready message is sent when the receiver changes from or to backup mode.

type.name: awake
type.description: not in backup mode

message.name: UBX-MON-SMGR
message.comment: This message reports the status of internal and external oscillators and sources as well as whether GNSS is used for disciplining.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: intOsc
block.comment: A bit mask, indicating the status of the local oscillator

type.name: intOscState
type.description: State of the oscillator: 0: autonomous operation 1: calibration ongoing 2: oscillator is steered by the host 3: idle state

type.name: intOscCalib
type.description: 1 = oscillator gain is calibrated

type.name: intOscDisc
type.description: 1 = signal is disciplined

block.name: extOsc
block.comment: A bit mask, indicating the status of the external oscillator

type.name: extOscState
type.description: State of the oscillator: 0: autonomous operation 1: calibration ongoing 2: oscillator is steered by the host 3: idle state

type.name: extOscCalib
type.description: 1 = oscillator gain is calibrated

type.name: extOscDisc
type.description: 1 = signal is disciplined

block.name: discSrc
block.comment: Disciplining source identifier: 0: internal oscillator 1: GNSS 2: EXTINT0 3: EXTINT1 4: internal oscillator measured by the host 5: external oscillator measured by the host

block.name: gnss
block.comment: A bit mask, indicating the status of the GNSS

type.name: gnssAvail
type.description: 1 = GNSS is present

block.name: extInt0
block.comment: A bit mask, indicating the status of the external input 0

type.name: extInt0Avail
type.description: 1 = signal present at this input

type.name: extInt0Type
type.description: Source type: 0: frequency 1: time

type.name: extInt0FeedBack
type.description: This source is used as feedback of the external oscillator

block.name: extInt1
block.comment: A bit mask, indicating the status of the external input 1

type.name: extInt1Avail
type.description: 1 = signal present at this input

type.name: extInt1Type
type.description: Source type: 0: frequency 1: time

type.name: extInt1FeedBack
type.description: This source is used as feedback of the external oscillator

block.name: pending
block.comment: Number of bytes pending in transmitter buffer for each target

block.name: usage
block.comment: Maximum usage transmitter buffer during the last sysmon period for each target

block.name: peakUsage
block.comment: Maximum usage transmitter buffer for each target

block.name: tUsage
block.comment: Maximum usage of transmitter buffer during the last sysmon period for all targets

block.name: tPeakusage
block.comment: Maximum usage of transmitter buffer for all targets

type.name: limit
type.description: Buffer limit of corresponding target reached

type.name: mem
type.description: Memory Allocation error

type.name: alloc
type.description: Allocation error (TX buffer full)

block.name: extension
block.comment: Extended software information strings. A series of nul-terminated strings. Each extension field is 30 characters long and contains varying software information. Not all extension fields may appear. Examples of reported information: the software version string of the underlying ROM (when the receiver's firmware is running from flash), the firmware version, the supported protocol version, the module identifier, the flash information structure (FIS) file information, the supported major GNSS, the supported augmentation systems. See Firmware and protocol versions for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-AOPSTATUS
message.comment: This message provides information on the status of the AssistNow Autonomous subsystem on the receiver. For example, a host application can determine the optimal time to shut down the receiver by monitoring the status field for a steady 0. See the chapter AssistNow Autonomous in the receiver description for details on this feature.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

type.name: useAOP
type.description: AOP enabled flag

block.name: status
block.comment: AssistNow Autonomous subsystem is idle (0) or running (not 0)

message.name: UBX-NAV-ATT
message.comment: This message outputs the attitude solution as roll, pitch and heading angles. More details about vehicle attitude can be found in the Vehicle Attitude Output (ADR) section for ADR products. More details about vehicle attitude can be found in the Vehicle Attitude Output (UDR) section for UDR products.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or UDR products)

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: accRoll
block.comment: Vehicle roll accuracy (if null, roll angle is not available).

block.name: accPitch
block.comment: Vehicle pitch accuracy (if null, pitch angle is not available).

block.name: accHeading
block.comment: Vehicle heading accuracy (if null, heading angle is not available).

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-DGPS
message.comment: This message outputs the DGPS correction data that has been applied to the current NAV Solution. See also the notes on the RTCM protocol.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: numCh
block.comment: Number of channels for which correction data is following

block.name: status
block.comment: DGPS correction type status: 0x00: none 0x01: PR+PRR correction

type.name: channel
type.description: GPS channel number this SV is on. Channel numbers in the firmware greater than 15 are displayed as having channel number 15

type.name: dgpsUsed
type.description: 1 = DGPS used for this SV

message.name: UBX-NAV-DOP
message.comment: DOP values are dimensionless. All DOP values are scaled by a factor of 100. If the unit transmits a value of e.g. 156, the DOP value is 1.56.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-EOE
message.comment: This message is intended to be used as a marker to collect all navigation messages of an epoch. It is output after all enabled NAV class messages (except UBX-NAV-HNR) and after all enabled NMEA messages.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-GEOFENCE
message.comment: This message outputs the evaluated states of all configured geofences for the current epoch's position. See the Geofencing description for feature details.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: status
block.comment: Geofencing status 0 - Geofencing not available or not reliable 1 - Geofencing active

block.name: combState
block.comment: Combined (logical OR) state of all geofences 0 - Unknown 1 - Inside 2 - Outside

message.name: UBX-NAV-HPPOSECEF
message.description: High precision position solution in ECEF
message.comment: See important comments concerning validity of position given in section Navigation Output Filters.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: ecefXHp
block.comment: High precision component of ECEF X coordinate. Must be in the range of -99.. +99. Precise coordinate in cm = ecefX + (ecefXHp * 1e-2).

block.name: ecefYHp
block.comment: High precision component of ECEF Y coordinate. Must be in the range of -99.. +99. Precise coordinate in cm = ecefY + (ecefYHp * 1e-2).

block.name: ecefZHp
block.comment: High precision component of ECEF Z coordinate. Must be in the range of -99.. +99. Precise coordinate in cm = ecefZ + (ecefZHp * 1e-2).

type.name: invalidEcef
type.description: 1 = Invalid ecefX, ecefY, ecefZ, ecefXHp, ecefYHp and ecefZHp

message.name: UBX-NAV-HPPOSLLH
message.comment: See important comments concerning validity of position given in section Navigation Output Filters. This message outputs the Geodetic position with high precision in the currently selected ellipsoid. The default is the WGS84 Ellipsoid, but can be changed with the message UBX-CFG-DAT.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01

type.name: invalidLlh
type.description: 1 = Invalid lon, lat, height, hMSL, lonHp, latHp, heightHp and hMSLHp

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: lonHp
block.comment: High precision component of longitude. Must be in the range -99..+99. Precise longitude in deg * 1e-7 = lon + (lonHp * 1e- 2).

block.name: latHp
block.comment: High precision component of latitude. Must be in the range -99..+99. Precise latitude in deg * 1e-7 = lat + (latHp * 1e-2).

block.name: heightHp
block.comment: High precision component of height above ellipsoid. Must be in the range -9..+9. Precise height in mm = height + (heightHp * 0.1).

block.name: hMSLHp
block.comment: High precision component of height above mean sea level. Must be in range -9..+9. Precise height in mm = hMSL + (hMSLHp * 0.1)

message.name: UBX-NAV-NMI
message.comment: Information about the validity of received satellite navigation payload.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 22.01

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: gpsNmiFlags
block.comment: GPS navigation message cross-check information flags.

type.name: wnoCheckedGPS
type.description: 1 = week number check performed.

type.name: wnoInvalidGPS
type.description: 1 = week number invalid.

block.name: gpsLsFlags
block.comment: GPS leap second cross-check information flags.

type.name: lsValGPS
type.description: 1 = Leap second value out of range.

type.name: dnRangeGPS
type.description: 1 = Day number value out of range.

type.name: totRangeGPS
type.description: 1 = Data reference ToW out of range.

type.name: lsEventGPS
type.description: 1 = Unexpected leap second event.

type.name: recNowGPS
type.description: 1 = Data received this epoch.

block.name: galNmiFlags
block.comment: Galileo navigation message cross-check information flags.

type.name: wnoCheckedGAL
type.description: 1 = week number check performed.

type.name: wnoInvalidGAL
type.description: 1 = week number invalid.

block.name: galLsFlags
block.comment: Galileo leap second cross-check information flags.

type.name: lsValGAL
type.description: 1 = Leap second value out of range.

type.name: dnRangeGAL
type.description: 1 = Day number value out of range.

type.name: totRangeGAL
type.description: 1 = Data reference ToW out of range.

type.name: lsEventGAL
type.description: 1 = Unexpected leap second event.

type.name: recNowGAL
type.description: 1 = Data received this epoch.

block.name: bdsNmiFlags
block.comment: BeiDou navigation message cross-check information flags.

type.name: wnoCheckedBDS
type.description: 1 = week number check performed.

type.name: wnoInvalidBDS
type.description: 1 = week number invalid.

block.name: bdsLsFlags
block.comment: BeiDou leap second cross-check information flags.

type.name: lsValBDS
type.description: 1 = Leap second value out of range.

type.name: dnRangeBDS
type.description: 1 = Day number value out of range.

type.name: totRangeBDS
type.description: 1 = Data reference ToW out of range.

type.name: lsEventBDS
type.description: 1 = Unexpected leap second event.

type.name: recNowBDS
type.description: 1 = Data received this epoch.

block.name: gloNmiFlags
block.comment: GLONASS navigation message cross- check information flags.

type.name: wnoCheckedGLO
type.description: 1 = week number check performed.

type.name: wnoInvalidGLO
type.description: 1 = week number invalid.

message.name: UBX-NAV-ODO
message.comment: This message outputs the traveled distance since last reset (see UBX-NAV- RESETODO) together with an associated estimated accuracy and the total cumulated ground distance (can only be reset by a cold start of the receiver).

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-ORB
message.comment: Status of the GNSS orbit database knowledge.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: numSv
block.comment: Number of SVs in the database

type.name: health
type.description: SV health: 0: unknown 1: healthy 2: not healty

type.name: visibility
type.description: SV health: 0: unknown 1: below horizon 2: above horizon 3: above elevation mask

type.name: ephUsability
type.description: How long the receiver will be able to use the stored ephemeris data from now on: 31: The usability period is unknown 30: The usability period is more than 450 minutes 30 > n > 0: The usability period is between (n-1)*15 and n*15 minutes 0: Ephemeris can no longer be used

type.name: ephSource
type.description: 0: not available 1: GNSS transmission 2: external aiding 3-7: other

type.name: almUsability
type.description: How long the receiver will be able to use the stored almanac data from now on: 31: The usability period is unknown 30: The usability period is more than 30 days 30 > n > 0: The usability period is between n-1 and n days 0: Almanac can no longer be used

type.name: almSource
type.description: 0: not available 1: GNSS transmission 2: external aiding 3-7: other

type.name: anoAopUsability
type.description: How long the receiver will be able to use the orbit data from now on: 31: The usability period is unknown 30: The usability period is more than 30 days 30 > n > 0: The usability period is between n-1 and n days 0: Data can no longer be used

type.name: type
type.description: Type of orbit data: 0: No orbit data available 1: AssistNow Offline data 2: AssistNow Autonomous data 3-7: Other orbit data

message.name: UBX-NAV-POSECEF
message.comment: See important comments concerning validity of position given in section Navigation Output Filters.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-POSLLH
message.comment: See important comments concerning validity of position given in section Navigation Output Filters. This message outputs the Geodetic position in the currently selected ellipsoid. The default is the WGS84 Ellipsoid, but can be changed with the message UBX- CFG-DAT.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-PVT
message.comment: This message combines position, velocity and time solution, including accuracy figures. Note that during a leap second there may be more or less than 60 seconds in a minute. See the description of leap seconds for details.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

type.name: validDate
type.description: 1 = valid UTC Date (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: validTime
type.description: 1 = valid UTC time of day (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: fullyResolved
type.description: 1 = UTC time of day has been fully resolved (no seconds uncertainty). Cannot be used to check if time is completely solved.

type.name: validMag
type.description: 1 = valid magnetic declination

block.name: fixType
block.comment: GNSSfix Type: 0: no fix 1: dead reckoning only 2: 2D-fix 3: 3D-fix 4: GNSS + dead reckoning combined 5: time only fix

type.name: gnssFixOK
type.description: 1 = valid fix (i.e within DOP & accuracy masks)

type.name: diffSoln
type.description: 1 = differential corrections were applied

type.name: headVehValid
type.description: 1 = heading of vehicle is valid, only set if the receiver is in sensor fusion mode

type.name: carrSoln
type.description: Carrier phase range solution status: 0: no carrier phase range solution 1: carrier phase range solution with floating ambiguities 2: carrier phase range solution with fixed ambiguities (not supported in protocol versions less than 20)

type.name: confirmedAvai
type.description: 1 = information about UTC Date and Time of Day validity confirmation is available (see Time Validity section for details) This flag is only supported in Protocol Versions 19.00, 19.10, 20.10, 20.20, 20.30, 22.00, 23.00, 23.01, 27 and 28.

type.name: confirmedDate
type.description: 1 = UTC Date validity could be confirmed (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: confirmedTime
type.description: 1 = UTC Time of Day could be confirmed (see Time Validity section for details)

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Number of satellites used in Nav Solution

block.name: headAcc
block.comment: Heading accuracy estimate (both motion and vehicle)

type.name: invalidLlh
type.description: 1 = Invalid lon, lat, height and hMSL

block.name: headVeh
block.comment: Heading of vehicle (2-D), this is only valid when headVehValid is set, otherwise the output is set to the heading of motion

block.name: magDec
block.comment: Magnetic declination. Only supported in ADR 4.10 and later.

block.name: magAcc
block.comment: Magnetic declination accuracy. Only supported in ADR 4.10 and later.

message.name: UBX-NAV-RELPOSNED
message.description: Relative positioning information in NED frame
message.comment: The NED frame is defined as the local topological system at the reference station. The relative position vector components in this message, along with their associated accuracies, are given in that local topological system. This message contains the relative position vector from the Reference Station to the Rover, including accuracy figures, in the local topological system defined at the reference station
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with High Precision GNSS products)

block.name: refStationId
block.comment: Reference Station ID. Must be in the range 0..4095

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: relPosN
block.comment: North component of relative position vector

block.name: relPosE
block.comment: East component of relative position vector

block.name: relPosD
block.comment: Down component of relative position vector

block.name: relPosHPN
block.comment: High-precision North component of relative position vector. Must be in the range -99 to +99. The full North component of the relative position vector, in units of cm, is given by relPosN + (relPosHPN * 1e-2)

block.name: relPosHPE
block.comment: High-precision East component of relative position vector. Must be in the range -99 to +99. The full East component of the relative position vector, in units of cm, is given by relPosE + (relPosHPE * 1e-2)

block.name: relPosHPD
block.comment: High-precision Down component of relative position vector. Must be in the range -99 to +99. The full Down component of the relative position vector, in units of cm, is given by relPosD + (relPosHPD * 1e-2)

block.name: accN
block.comment: Accuracy of relative position North component

block.name: accE
block.comment: Accuracy of relative position East component

block.name: accD
block.comment: Accuracy of relative position Down component

type.name: gnssFixOK
type.description: A valid fix (i.e within DOP & accuracy masks)

type.name: diffSoln
type.description: 1 if differential corrections were applied

type.name: relPosValid
type.description: 1 if relative position components and accuracies are valid

type.name: carrSoln
type.description: Carrier phase range solution status: 0 = no carrier phase range solution 1 = carrier phase range solution with floating ambiguities 2 = carrier phase range solution with fixed ambiguities

type.name: isMoving
type.description: 1 if the receiver is operating in moving baseline mode (not supported in protocol versions less than 20.3)

type.name: refPosMiss
type.description: 1 if extrapolated reference position was used to compute moving baseline solution this epoch (not supported in protocol versions less than 20.3)

type.name: refObsMiss
type.description: 1 if extrapolated reference observations were used to compute moving baseline solution this epoch (not supported in protocol versions less than 20.3)

message.name: UBX-NAV-RESETODO
message.comment: This message resets the traveled distance computed by the odometer (see UBX- NAV-ODO). UBX-ACK-ACK or UBX-ACK-NAK are returned to indicate success or failure.

message.name: UBX-NAV-SAT
message.comment: This message displays information about SVs that are either known to be visible or currently tracked by the receiver. All signal related information corresponds to the subset of signals specified in Signal Identifiers.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: gnssId
block.comment: GNSS identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

block.name: svId
block.comment: Satellite identifier (see Satellite Numbering) for assignment

block.name: elev
block.comment: Elevation (range: +/-90), unknown if out of range

block.name: azim
block.comment: Azimuth (range 0-360), unknown if elevation is out of range

type.name: qualityInd
type.description: Signal quality indicator: 0: no signal 1: searching signal 2: signal acquired 3: signal detected but unusable 4: code locked and time synchronized 5, 6, 7: code and carrier locked and time synchronized Note: Since IMES signals are not time synchronized, a channel tracking an IMES signal can never reach a quality indicator value of higher than 3.

type.name: svUsed
type.description: 1 = Signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers is currently being used for navigation

type.name: health
type.description: Signal health flag: 0: unknown 1: healthy 2: unhealthy

type.name: diffCorr
type.description: 1 = differential correction data is available for this SV

type.name: smoothed
type.description: 1 = carrier smoothed pseudorange used

type.name: orbitSource
type.description: Orbit source: 0: no orbit information is available for this SV 1: ephemeris is used 2: almanac is used 3: AssistNow Offline orbit is used 4: AssistNow Autonomous orbit is used 5, 6, 7: other orbit information is used

type.name: ephAvail
type.description: 1 = ephemeris is available for this SV

type.name: almAvail
type.description: 1 = almanac is available for this SV

type.name: anoAvail
type.description: 1 = AssistNow Offline data is available for this SV

type.name: aopAvail
type.description: 1 = AssistNow Autonomous data is available for this SV

type.name: sbasCorrUsed
type.description: 1 = SBAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

type.name: rtcmCorrUsed
type.description: 1 = RTCM corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

type.name: slasCorrUsed
type.description: 1 = QZSS SLAS corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

type.name: prCorrUsed
type.description: 1 = Pseudorange corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

type.name: crCorrUsed
type.description: 1 = Carrier range corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

type.name: doCorrUsed
type.description: 1 = Range rate (Doppler) corrections have been used for a signal in the subset specified in Signal Identifiers

message.name: UBX-NAV-SBAS
message.comment: This message outputs the status of the SBAS sub system

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: geo
block.comment: PRN Number of the GEO where correction and integrity data is used from

block.name: mode
block.comment: SBAS Mode 0 Disabled 1 Enabled integrity 3 Enabled test mode

block.name: sys
block.comment: SBAS System (WAAS/EGNOS/...) -1 Unknown 0 WAAS 1 EGNOS 2 MSAS 3 GAGAN 16 GPS

type.name: Ranging
type.description: GEO may be used as ranging source

type.name: Corrections
type.description: GEO is providing correction data

type.name: Integrity
type.description: GEO is providing integrity

type.name: Testmode
type.description: GEO is in test mode

type.name: Bad
type.description: Problem with signal or broadcast data indicated

message.name: UBX-NAV-SLAS
message.comment: This message outputs the status of the QZSS L1S SLAS sub system
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 19.2

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: gmsLon
block.comment: Longitude of the used ground monitoring station

block.name: gmsLat
block.comment: Latitude of the used ground monitoring station

block.name: gmsCode
block.comment: Code of the used ground monitoring station according to the QZSS SLAS Interface Specification, available from qzss.go.jp/en/

block.name: qzssSvId
block.comment: Satellite identifier of the QZS/GEO whose correction data is used (see Satellite Numbering)

type.name: gmsAvailable
type.description: 1 = Ground monitoring station available

type.name: qzssSvAvailable
type.description: 1 = Correction providing QZSS SV available

type.name: testMode
type.description: 1 = Currently used QZSS SV in test mode

message.name: UBX-NAV-SOL
message.comment: This message combines position, velocity and time solution in ECEF, including accuracy figures. This message has only been retained for backwards compatibility; users are recommended to use the UBX-NAV-PVT message in preference.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: fTOW
block.comment: Fractional part of iTOW (range: +/- 500000). The precise GPS time of week in seconds is: (iTOW * 1e-3) + (fTOW * 1e-9)

block.name: week
block.comment: GPS week number of the navigation epoch

block.name: gpsFix
block.comment: GPSfix Type, range 0..5 0x00 = No Fix 0x01 = Dead Reckoning only 0x02 = 2D-Fix 0x03 = 3D-Fix 0x04 = GPS + dead reckoning combined 0x05 = Time only fix 0x06..0xff: reserved

type.name: GPSfixOK
type.description: 1 = Fix within limits (e.g. DOP & accuracy)

type.name: DiffSoln
type.description: 1 = DGPS used

type.name: WKNSET
type.description: 1 = Valid GPS week number (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: TOWSET
type.description: 1 = Valid GPS time of week (iTOW & fTOW, see Time Validity section for details)

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Number of SVs used in Nav Solution

message.name: UBX-NAV-STATUS
message.comment: See important comments concerning validity of position given in section Navigation Output Filters.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: gpsFix
block.comment: GPSfix Type, this value does not qualify a fix as valid and within the limits. See note on flag gpsFixOk below. 0x00 = no fix 0x01 = dead reckoning only 0x02 = 2D-fix 0x03 = 3D-fix 0x04 = GPS + dead reckoning combined 0x05 = Time only fix 0x06..0xff = reserved

type.name: gpsFixOk
type.description: 1 = position and velocity valid and within DOP and ACC Masks.

type.name: diffSoln
type.description: 1 = differential corrections were applied

type.name: wknSet
type.description: 1 = Week Number valid (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: towSet
type.description: 1 = Time of Week valid (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: diffCorr
type.description: 1 = differential corrections available

type.name: carrSolnValid
type.description: 1 = valid carrSoln

type.name: mapMatching
type.description: map matching status: 00: none 01: valid but not used, i.e. map matching data was received, but was too old 10: valid and used, map matching data was applied 11: valid and used, map matching data was applied. In case of sensor unavailability map matching data enables dead reckoning. This requires map matched latitude/longitude or heading data.

type.name: psmState
type.description: power save mode state 0: ACQUISITION [or when psm disabled] 1: TRACKING 2: POWER OPTIMIZED TRACKING 3: INACTIVE

type.name: spoofDetState
type.description: Spoofing detection state (not supported in protocol versions less than 18) 0: Unknown or deactivated 1: No spoofing indicated 2: Spoofing indicated 3: Multiple spoofing indications Note that the spoofing state value only reflects the dector state for the current navigation epoch. As spoofing can be detected most easily at the transition from real signal to spoofing signal, this is also where the detector is triggered the most. I.e. a value of 1 - No spoofing indicated does not mean that the receiver is not spoofed, it simply states that the detector was not triggered in this epoch.

type.name: carrSoln
type.description: Carrier phase range solution status: 0: no carrier phase range solution 1: carrier phase range solution with floating ambiguities 2: carrier phase range solution with fixed ambiguities

block.name: ttff
block.comment: Time to first fix (millisecond time tag)

message.name: UBX-NAV-SVINFO
message.comment: Information about satellites used or visible This message has only been retained for backwards compatibility; users are recommended to use the UBX-NAV-SAT message in preference.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

type.name: chipGen
type.description: Chip hardware generation 0: Antaris, Antaris 4 1: u-blox 5 2: u-blox 6 3: u-blox 7 4: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8

block.name: chn
block.comment: Channel number, 255 for SVs not assigned to a channel

block.name: svid
block.comment: Satellite ID, see Satellite Numbering for assignment

type.name: svUsed
type.description: SV is used for navigation

type.name: diffCorr
type.description: Differential correction data is available for this SV

type.name: orbitAvail
type.description: Orbit information is available for this SV (Ephemeris or Almanac)

type.name: orbitEph
type.description: Orbit information is Ephemeris

type.name: unhealthy
type.description: SV is unhealthy / shall not be used

type.name: orbitAlm
type.description: Orbit information is Almanac Plus

type.name: orbitAop
type.description: Orbit information is AssistNow Autonomous

type.name: smoothed
type.description: Carrier smoothed pseudorange used

type.name: qualityInd
type.description: Signal Quality indicator (range 0..7). The following list shows the meaning of the different QI values: 0: no signal 1: searching signal 2: signal acquired 3: signal detected but unusable 4: code locked and time synchronized 5, 6, 7: code and carrier locked and time synchronized Note: Since IMES signals are not time synchronized, a channel tracking an IMES signal can never reach a quality indicator value of higher than 3.

message.name: UBX-NAV-SVIN
message.comment: This message contains information about survey-in parameters.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2 and 20.3 (only with High Precision GNSS products)

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: meanX
block.comment: Current survey-in mean position ECEF X coordinate

block.name: meanY
block.comment: Current survey-in mean position ECEF Y coordinate

block.name: meanZ
block.comment: Current survey-in mean position ECEF Z coordinate

block.name: meanXHP
block.comment: Current high-precision survey-in mean position ECEF X coordinate. Must be in the range -99..+99. The current survey-in mean position ECEF X coordinate, in units of cm, is given by meanX + (0.01 * meanXHP)

block.name: meanYHP
block.comment: Current high-precision survey-in mean position ECEF Y coordinate. Must be in the range -99..+99. The current survey-in mean position ECEF Y coordinate, in units of cm, is given by meanY + (0.01 * meanYHP)

block.name: meanZHP
block.comment: Current high-precision survey-in mean position ECEF Z coordinate. Must be in the range -99..+99. The current survey-in mean position ECEF Z coordinate, in units of cm, is given by meanZ + (0.01 * meanZHP)

block.name: obs
block.comment: Number of position observations used during survey-in

block.name: valid
block.comment: Survey-in position validity flag, 1 = valid, otherwise 0

block.name: active
block.comment: Survey-in in progress flag, 1 = in-progress, otherwise 0

message.name: UBX-NAV-TIMEBDS
message.comment: This message reports the precise BDS time of the most recent navigation solution including validity flags and an accuracy estimate.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: SOW
block.comment: BDS time of week (rounded to seconds)

block.name: fSOW
block.comment: Fractional part of SOW (range: +/- 500000000). The precise BDS time of week in seconds is: SOW + fSOW * 1e-9

block.name: week
block.comment: BDS week number of the navigation epoch

type.name: sowValid
type.description: 1 = Valid SOW and fSOW (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: weekValid
type.description: 1 = Valid week (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: leapSValid
type.description: 1 = Valid leap second

message.name: UBX-NAV-TIMEGAL
message.comment: This message reports the precise Galileo time of the most recent navigation solution including validity flags and an accuracy estimate.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: galTow
block.comment: Galileo time of week (rounded to seconds)

block.name: fGalTow
block.comment: Fractional part of the Galileo time of week (range: +/-500000000). The precise Galileo time of week in seconds is: galTow + fGalTow * 1e-9

type.name: galTowValid
type.description: 1 = Valid galTow and fGalTow (see the section Time validity in the Integration manual for details)

type.name: galWnoValid
type.description: 1 = Valid galWno (see the section Time validity in the Integration manual for details)

type.name: leapSValid
type.description: 1 = Valid leapS

message.name: UBX-NAV-TIMEGLO
message.comment: This message reports the precise GLO time of the most recent navigation solution including validity flags and an accuracy estimate.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: TOD
block.comment: GLONASS time of day (rounded to integer seconds)

block.name: fTOD
block.comment: Fractional part of TOD (range: +/- 500000000). The precise GLONASS time of day in seconds is: TOD + fTOD * 1e-9

block.name: Nt
block.comment: Current date (range: 1-1461), starting at 1 from the 1st Jan of the year indicated by N4 and ending at 1461 at the 31st Dec of the third year after that indicated by N4

type.name: todValid
type.description: 1 = Valid TOD and fTOD (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: dateValid
type.description: 1 = Valid N4 and Nt (see Time Validity section for details)

message.name: UBX-NAV-TIMEGPS
message.comment: This message reports the precise GPS time of the most recent navigation solution including validity flags and an accuracy estimate.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: fTOW
block.comment: Fractional part of iTOW (range: +/- 500000). The precise GPS time of week in seconds is: (iTOW * 1e-3) + (fTOW * 1e-9)

block.name: week
block.comment: GPS week number of the navigation epoch

type.name: towValid
type.description: 1 = Valid GPS time of week (iTOW & fTOW, (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: weekValid
type.description: 1 = Valid GPS week number (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: leapSValid
type.description: 1 = Valid GPS leap seconds

message.name: UBX-NAV-TIMELS
message.comment: Information about the upcoming leap second event if one is scheduled.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: srcOfCurrLs
block.comment: Information source for the current number of leap seconds. 0: Default (hardcoded in the firmware, can be outdated) 1: Derived from time difference between GPS and GLONASS time 2: GPS 3: SBAS 4: BeiDou 5: Galileo 6: Aided data 7: Configured 255: Unknown

block.name: currLs
block.comment: Current number of leap seconds since start of GPS time (Jan 6, 1980). It reflects how much GPS time is ahead of UTC time. Galileo number of leap seconds is the same as GPS. BeiDou number of leap seconds is 14 less than GPS. GLONASS follows UTC time, so no leap seconds.

block.name: srcOfLsChange
block.comment: Information source for the future leap second event. 0: No source 2: GPS 3: SBAS 4: BeiDou 5: Galileo 6: GLONASS

block.name: lsChange
block.comment: Future leap second change if one is scheduled. +1 = positive leap second, -1 = negative leap second, 0 = no future leap second event scheduled or no information available.

block.name: timeToLsEvent
block.comment: Number of seconds until the next leap second event, or from the last leap second event if no future event scheduled. If > 0 event is in the future, = 0 event is now, < 0 event is in the past. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1.

block.name: dateOfLsGpsWn
block.comment: GPS week number (WN) of the next leap second event or the last one if no future event scheduled. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1.

block.name: dateOfLsGpsDn
block.comment: GPS day of week number (DN) for the next leap second event or the last one if no future event scheduled. Valid only if validTimeToLsEvent = 1. (GPS and Galileo DN: from 1 = Sun to 7 = Sat. BeiDou DN: from 0 = Sun to 6 = Sat.)

type.name: validCurrLs
type.description: 1 = Valid current number of leap seconds value.

type.name: validTimeToLsEvent
type.description: 1 = Valid time to next leap second event or from the last leap second event if no future event scheduled.

message.name: UBX-NAV-TIMEUTC
message.comment: Note that during a leap second there may be more or less than 60 seconds in a minute. See the description of leap seconds for details.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

type.name: validTOW
type.description: 1 = Valid Time of Week (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: validWKN
type.description: 1 = Valid Week Number (see Time Validity section for details)

type.name: validUTC
type.description: 1 = Valid UTC Time

type.name: utcStandard
type.description: UTC standard identifier. 0: Information not available 1: Communications Research Labratory (CRL), Tokyo, Japan 2: National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 3: U.S. Naval Observatory (USNO) 4: International Bureau of Weights and Measures (BIPM) 5: European laboratories 6: Former Soviet Union (SU) 7: National Time Service Center (NTSC), China 15: Unknown

message.name: UBX-NAV-VELECEF
message.comment: See important comments concerning validity of position given in section Navigation Output Filters.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-NAV-VELNED
message.comment: See important comments concerning validity of position given in section Navigation Output Filters.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

message.name: UBX-RXM-IMES
message.comment: This message shows the IMES stations the receiver is currently tracking, their data rate, the signal level, the Doppler (with respect to 1575.4282MHz) and what data (without protocol specific overhead) it has received from these stations so far. This message is sent out at the navigation rate the receiver is currently set to. Therefore it allows users to get an overview on the receiver's current state from the IMES perspective.

block.name: numTx
block.comment: Number of transmitters contained in the message

block.name: doppler
block.comment: Doppler frequency with respect to 1575. 4282MHz [IIIII.FFF Hz]

type.name: pos1Floor
type.description: Floor number [1.0 floor resolution] (Offset: -50 floor)

type.name: pos1Lat
type.description: Latitude [deg * (180 / 2^23)]

type.name: pos1Lon
type.description: Longitude [deg * (360 / 2^24)]

type.name: pos1Valid
type.description: Position 1 Frame valid

type.name: pos2Floor
type.description: Floor number [0.5 floor resolution] (Offset: -50 floor)

type.name: pos2Alt
type.description: Altitude [m] (Offset: -95m)

type.name: pos2Acc
type.description: Accuracy Index (0:undef, 1:<7m, 2:<15m, 3:>15m)

type.name: pos2Valid
type.description: Position 2 Frame valid

type.name: shortId
type.description: Short ID

type.name: shortValid
type.description: Short ID Frame valid

type.name: shortBoundary
type.description: Boundary Bit

block.name: mediumIdLSB
block.comment: Medium ID LSB, Medium ID Frame (part 1/2)

type.name: mediumIdMSB
type.description: Medium ID MSB

type.name: mediumValid
type.description: Medium ID Frame valid

type.name: mediumboundary
type.description: Boundary Bit

message.name: UBX-RXM-MEASX
message.comment: The message payload data is, where possible and appropriate, according to the Radio Resource LCS (Location Services) Protocol (RRLP) [1]. One exception is the satellite and GNSS IDs, which here are given according to the Satellite Numbering scheme. The correct satellites have to be selected and their satellite ID translated accordingly [1, tab. A.10.14] for use in a RRLP Measure Position Response Component. Similarly, the measurement reference time of week has to be forwarded correctly (modulo 14400000 for the 24 LSB GPS measurements variant, modulo 3600000 for the 22 LSB Galileo and Additional Navigation Satelllite Systems (GANSS) measurements variant) of the RRLP measure position response to the SMLC. Reference: [1] ETSI TS 144 031 V11.0.0 (2012-10), Digital cellular telecommunications system (Phase 2+), Location Services (LCS), Mobile Station (MS) - Serving Mobile Location Centre (SMLC), Radio Resource LCS Protocol (RRLP), (3GPP TS 44.031 version 11.0.0 Release 11).

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Number of satellites in repeated block

type.name: towSet
type.description: TOW set (0 = no, 1 or 2 = yes)

block.name: mpathIndic
block.comment: multipath index (according to [1]) (0 = not measured, 1 = low, 2 = medium, 3 = high)

block.name: wholeChips
block.comment: whole value of the code phase measurement (0..1022 for GPS)

block.name: fracChips
block.comment: fractional value of the code phase measurement (0..1023)

message.name: UBX-RXM-PMREQ
message.comment: This message requests a power management related task of the receiver.

block.name: duration
block.comment: Duration of the requested task, set to zero for infinite duration. The maximum supported time is 12 days.

type.name: backup
type.description: The receiver goes into backup mode for a time period defined by duration, provided that it is not connected to USB

message.name: UBX-RXM-PMREQ
message.comment: This message requests a power management related task of the receiver.

block.name: duration
block.comment: Duration of the requested task, set to zero for infinite duration. The maximum supported time is 12 days.

type.name: backup
type.description: The receiver goes into backup mode for a time period defined by duration, provided that it is not connected to USB

type.name: force
type.description: Force receiver backup while USB is connected. USB interface will be disabled.

block.name: wakeupSources
block.comment: Configure pins to wake up the receiver. The receiver wakes up if there is either a falling or a rising edge on one of the configured pins.

type.name: uartrx
type.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the UART RX pin

type.name: extint0
type.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT0 pin

type.name: extint1
type.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the EXTINT1 pin

type.name: spics
type.description: Wake up the receiver if there is an edge on the SPI CS pin

message.name: UBX-RXM-RAWX
message.comment: This message contains the information needed to be able to generate a RINEX 3 multi-GNSS observation file (see ftp://ftp.igs.org/pub/data/format/). This message contains pseudorange, Doppler, carrier phase, phase lock and signal quality information for GNSS satellites once signals have been synchronized. This message supports all active GNSS.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 17 (only with Time Sync products)

block.name: rcvTow
block.comment: Measurement time of week in receiver local time approximately aligned to the GPS time system. The receiver local time of week, week number and leap second information can be used to translate the time to other time systems. More information about the difference in time systems can be found in the RINEX 3 format documentation. For a receiver operating in GLONASS only mode, UTC time can be determined by subtracting the leapS field from GPS time regardless of whether the GPS leap seconds are valid.

block.name: week
block.comment: GPS week number in receiver local time.

block.name: leapS
block.comment: GPS leap seconds (GPS-UTC). This field represents the receiver's best knowledge of the leap seconds offset. A flag is given in the recStat bitfield to indicate if the leap seconds are known.

type.name: leapSec
type.description: Leap seconds have been determined

type.name: clkReset
type.description: Clock reset applied. Typically the receiver clock is changed in increments of integer milliseconds.

block.name: prMes
block.comment: Pseudorange measurement [m]. GLONASS inter frequency channel delays are compensated with an internal calibration table.

block.name: cpMes
block.comment: Carrier phase measurement [cycles]. The carrier phase initial ambiguity is initialized using an approximate value to make the magnitude of the phase close to the pseudorange measurement. Clock resets are applied to both phase and code measurements in accordance with the RINEX specification.

block.name: doMes
block.comment: Doppler measurement (positive sign for approaching satellites) [Hz]

block.name: gnssId
block.comment: GNSS identifier (see Satellite Numbering for a list of identifiers)

block.name: freqId
block.comment: Only used for GLONASS: This is the frequency slot + 7 (range from 0 to 13)

type.name: prStd
type.description: Estimated pseudorange standard deviation

block.name: cpStdev
block.comment: Estimated carrier phase measurement standard deviation (note a raw value of 0x0F indicates the value is invalid)

type.name: cpStd
type.description: Estimated carrier phase standard deviation

type.name: doStd
type.description: Estimated Doppler standard deviation

type.name: prValid
type.description: Pseudorange valid

type.name: cpValid
type.description: Carrier phase valid

type.name: halfCyc
type.description: Half cycle valid

type.name: subHalfCyc
type.description: Half cycle subtracted from phase

message.name: UBX-RXM-RAWX
message.comment: This message contains the information needed to be able to generate a RINEX 3 multi-GNSS observation file (see ftp://ftp.igs.org/pub/data/format/). This message contains pseudorange, Doppler, carrier phase, phase lock and signal quality information for GNSS satellites once signals have been synchronized. This message supports all active GNSS. The only difference between this version of the message and the previous version (UBX-RXM-RAWX-DATA0) is the addition of the version field.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with ADR or High Precision GNSS or Time Sync products)

block.name: rcvTow
block.comment: Measurement time of week in receiver local time approximately aligned to the GPS time system. The receiver local time of week, week number and leap second information can be used to translate the time to other time systems. More information about the difference in time systems can be found in the RINEX 3 format documentation. For a receiver operating in GLONASS only mode, UTC time can be determined by subtracting the leapS field from GPS time regardless of whether the GPS leap seconds are valid.

block.name: week
block.comment: GPS week number in receiver local time.

block.name: leapS
block.comment: GPS leap seconds (GPS-UTC). This field represents the receiver's best knowledge of the leap seconds offset. A flag is given in the recStat bitfield to indicate if the leap seconds are known.

type.name: leapSec
type.description: Leap seconds have been determined

type.name: clkReset
type.description: Clock reset applied. Typically the receiver clock is changed in increments of integer milliseconds.

block.name: prMes
block.comment: Pseudorange measurement [m]. GLONASS inter frequency channel delays are compensated with an internal calibration table.

block.name: cpMes
block.comment: Carrier phase measurement [cycles]. The carrier phase initial ambiguity is initialized using an approximate value to make the magnitude of the phase close to the pseudorange measurement. Clock resets are applied to both phase and code measurements in accordance with the RINEX specification.

block.name: doMes
block.comment: Doppler measurement (positive sign for approaching satellites) [Hz]

block.name: gnssId
block.comment: GNSS identifier (see Satellite Numbering for a list of identifiers)

block.name: sigId
block.comment: New style signal identifier (see Signal Identifiers).(not supported in protocol versions less than 27)

block.name: freqId
block.comment: Only used for GLONASS: This is the frequency slot + 7 (range from 0 to 13)

type.name: prStd
type.description: Estimated pseudorange standard deviation

block.name: cpStdev
block.comment: Estimated carrier phase measurement standard deviation (note a raw value of 0x0F indicates the value is invalid)

type.name: cpStd
type.description: Estimated carrier phase standard deviation

type.name: doStd
type.description: Estimated Doppler standard deviation

type.name: prValid
type.description: Pseudorange valid

type.name: cpValid
type.description: Carrier phase valid

type.name: halfCyc
type.description: Half cycle valid

type.name: subHalfCyc
type.description: Half cycle subtracted from phase

message.name: UBX-RXM-RLM
message.comment: This message contains the contents of any Galileo Search and Rescue (SAR) Short Return Link Message detected by the receiver.

block.name: svId
block.comment: Identifier of transmitting satellite (see Satellite Numbering)

block.name: beacon
block.comment: Beacon identifier (60 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first. Top four bits of first byte are zero.

block.name: params
block.comment: Parameters (16 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first.

message.name: UBX-RXM-RLM
message.comment: This message contains the contents of any Galileo Search and Rescue (SAR) Long Return Link Message detected by the receiver.

block.name: svId
block.comment: Identifier of transmitting satellite (see Satellite Numbering)

block.name: beacon
block.comment: Beacon identifier (60 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first. Top four bits of first byte are zero.

block.name: params
block.comment: Parameters (96 bits), with bytes ordered by earliest transmitted (most significant) first.

message.name: UBX-RXM-RTCM
message.comment: This message shows info on a received RTCM input message. It is output upon successful parsing of an RTCM input message, irrespective of whether the RTCM message is supported or not by the receiver.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 20.01, 20.1, 20.2 and 20.3

type.name: crcFailed
type.description: 0 when RTCM message received and passed CRC check, 1 when failed, in which case refStation and msgType might be corrupted and misleading

type.name: msgUsed
type.description: 2 = RTCM message used successfully by the receiver, 1 = not used, 0 = do not know

block.name: subType
block.comment: Message subtype, only applicable to u- blox proprietary RTCM message 4072 (not available on all products)

block.name: refStation
block.comment: Reference station ID: For RTCM 2.3: Reference station ID of the received RTCM 2 input message. Valid range 0-1023. For RTCM 3.3: Reference station ID (DF003) of the received RTCM input message. Valid range 0-4095. Reported only for the standard RTCM messages that include the DF003 field and for the u- blox proprietary RTCM messages 4072.x. For all other messages, reports 0xFFFF.

message.name: UBX-RXM-SFRBX
message.comment: This message reports a complete subframe of broadcast navigation data decoded from a single signal. The number of data words reported in each message depends on the nature of the signal. See the section on Broadcast Navigation Data for further details.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 with protocol version 17 (only with Time Sync products)

block.name: freqId
block.comment: Only used for GLONASS: This is the frequency slot + 7 (range from 0 to 13)

block.name: numWords
block.comment: The number of data words contained in this message (0..16)

message.name: UBX-RXM-SFRBX
message.comment: This message reports a complete subframe of broadcast navigation data decoded from a single signal. The number of data words reported in each message depends on the nature of the signal. See the section on Broadcast Navigation Data for further details.

block.name: freqId
block.comment: Only used for GLONASS: This is the frequency slot + 7 (range from 0 to 13)

block.name: numWords
block.comment: The number of data words contained in this message (up to 10, for currently supported signals)

block.name: chn
block.comment: The tracking channel number the message was received on

message.name: UBX-RXM-SVSI
message.comment: Status of the receiver manager knowledge about GPS Orbit Validity This message has only been retained for backwards compatibility; users are recommended to use the UBX-NAV-ORB message in preference.

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch. See the description of iTOW for details.

block.name: week
block.comment: GPS week number of the navigation epoch

block.name: numSV
block.comment: Number of per-SV data blocks following

type.name: ura
type.description: Figure of Merit (URA) range 0..15

type.name: healthy
type.description: SV healthy flag

type.name: ephVal
type.description: Ephemeris valid

type.name: almVal
type.description: Almanac valid

type.name: notAvail
type.description: SV not available

type.name: almAge
type.description: Age of ALM in days offset by 4 i.e. the reference time may be in the future: ageOfAlm = (age & 0x0f) - 4

type.name: ephAge
type.description: Age of EPH in hours offset by 4. i.e. the reference time may be in the future: ageOfEph = ((age & 0xf0) >> 4) - 4

message.name: UBX-SEC-UNIQID
message.comment: This message is used to retrieve a unique chip identifier (40 bits, 5 bytes).

message.name: UBX-TIM-DOSC
message.comment: The receiver sends this message when it is disciplining an external oscillator and the external oscillator is set up to be controlled via the host.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: value
block.comment: The raw value to be applied to the DAC controlling the external oscillator. The least significant bits should be written to the DAC, with the higher bits being ignored.

message.name: UBX-TIM-FCHG
message.comment: This message reports frequency changes commanded by the sync manager for the internal and external oscillator. It is output at the configured rate even if the sync manager decides not to command a frequency change.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: iTOW
block.comment: GPS time of week of the navigation epoch from which the sync manager obtains the GNSS specific data. Like for the NAV message, the iTOW can be used to group messages of a single sync manager run together (See the description of iTOW for details)

block.name: intDeltaFreq
block.comment: Frequency increment of the internal oscillator

block.name: intDeltaFreqUnc
block.comment: Uncertainty of the internal oscillator frequency increment

block.name: intRaw
block.comment: Current raw DAC setting commanded to the internal oscillator

block.name: extDeltaFreq
block.comment: Frequency increment of the external oscillator

block.name: extDeltaFreqUnc
block.comment: Uncertainty of the external oscillator frequency increment

block.name: extRaw
block.comment: Current raw DAC setting commanded to the external oscillator

message.name: UBX-TIM-HOC
message.comment: This message can be sent by the host to force the receiver to bypass the disciplining algorithms in the SMGR and carry out the instructed changes to internal or external oscillator frequency. No checks are carried out on the size of the frequency change requested, so normal limits imposed by the SMGR are ignored. It is recommended that the disciplining of that oscillator is disabled before this message is sent (i.e. by clearing the enableInternal or enableExternal flag in the UBX-CFG-SMGR message), otherwise the autonomous disciplining processes may cancel the effect of the direct command. Note that the GNSS subsystem may temporarily lose track of some/all satellite signals if a large change of the internal oscillator is made.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: oscId
block.comment: Id of oscillator: 0: internal oscillator 1: external oscillator

type.name: raw
type.description: Type of value: 0: frequency offset 1: raw digital output

type.name: difference
type.description: Nature of value: 0: absolute (i.e. relative to 0) 1: relative to current setting

block.name: value
block.comment: Required frequency offset or raw output, depending on the flags

message.name: UBX-TIM-SMEAS
message.comment: Frequency and/or phase measurement of synchronization sources. The measurements are relative to the nominal frequency and nominal phase. The receiver reports the measurements on its sync sources using this message. Which measurements are reported can be configured using UBX-CFG-SMGR. The host may report offset of the receiver's outputs with this message as well. The receiver has to be configured using UBX-CFG-SMGR to enable the use of the external measurement messages. Otherwise the receiver will ignore them.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20. 2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync products)

block.name: numMeas
block.comment: Number of measurements in repeated block

block.name: sourceId
block.comment: Index of source. SMEAS can provide six measurement sources. The first four sourceId values represent measurements made by the receiver and sent to the host. The first of these with a sourceId value of 0 is a measurement of the internal oscillator against the current receiver time-and-frequency estimate. The internal oscillator is being disciplined against that estimate and this result represents the current offset between the actual and desired internal oscillator states. The next three sourceId values represent frequency and time measurements made by the receiver against the internal oscillator. sourceId 1 represents the GNSS-derived frequency and time compared with the internal oscillator frequency and time. sourceId2 give measurements of a signal coming in on EXTINT0. sourceId 3 corresponds to a similar measurement on EXTINT1. The remaining two of these measurements (sourceId 4 and 5) are made by the host and sent to the receiver. A measurement with sourceId 4 is a measurement by the host of the internal oscillator and sourceId 5 indicates a host measurement of the external oscillator.

type.name: freqValid
type.description: 1 = frequency measurement is valid

type.name: phaseValid
type.description: 1 = phase measurement is valid

block.name: phaseOffsetFrac
block.comment: Sub-nanosecond phase offset; the total offset is the sum of phaseOffset and phaseOffsetFrac

block.name: phaseOffset
block.comment: Phase offset, positive if the source lags accurate phase and negative if the source is early

block.name: freqOffset
block.comment: Frequency offset, positive if the source frequency is too high, negative if the frequency is too low.

message.name: UBX-TIM-SVIN
message.comment: This message contains information about survey-in parameters. For details about the Time mode see section Time mode configuration.
message.firmware: Supported on: u-blox 8 / u-blox M8 protocol versions 15, 15.01, 16, 17, 18, 19, 19.1, 19.2, 20, 20.01, 20.1, 20.2, 20.3, 22, 22.01, 23 and 23.01 (only with Time & Frequency Sync or Time Sync products)

block.name: meanX
block.comment: Current survey-in mean position ECEF X coordinate

block.name: meanY
block.comment: Current survey-in mean position ECEF Y coordinate

block.name: meanZ
block.comment: Current survey-in mean position ECEF Z coordinate

block.name: obs
block.comment: Number of position observations used during survey-in

block.name: valid
block.comment: Survey-in position validity flag, 1 = valid, otherwise 0

block.name: active
block.comment: Survey-in in progress flag, 1 = in-progress, otherwise 0

message.name: UBX-TIM-TM2
message.comment: This message contains information for high precision time stamping / pulse counting. The delay figures and timebase given in UBX-CFG-TP5 are also applied to the time results output in this message.

block.name: ch
block.comment: Channel (i.e. EXTINT) upon which the pulse was measured

type.name: mode
type.description: 0=single 1=running

type.name: run
type.description: 0=armed 1=stopped

type.name: newFallingEdge
type.description: New falling edge detected

type.name: timeBase
type.description: 0=Time base is Receiver time 1=Time base is GNSS time (the system according to the configuration in UBX-CFG-TP5 for tpIdx=0) 2=Time base is UTC (the variant according to the configuration in UBX-CFG-NAV5)

type.name: utc
type.description: 0=UTC not available 1=UTC available

type.name: time
type.description: 0=Time is not valid 1=Time is valid (Valid GNSS fix)

type.name: newRisingEdge
type.description: New rising edge detected

block.name: wnR
